arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ أَبِي ذِئْبٍ، عَنْ شَيْخٍ، لَمْ يُسَمِّهِ، أَنَّ أَبَا بَكْرٍ، قَنَتَ فِي الْفَجْرِ
english_text: Waki‘ narrated to us, saying: Ibn Abi Dhi’b narrated to us from a Shaykh he did not name, that Abu Bakr performed Qunut in Fajr.
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← ابْنُ أَبِي ذِئْبٍ ← شَيْخٍ لَمْ يُسَمِّهِ
narrators_en: Waki‘ → Ibn Abi Dhi’b → A Shaykh he did not name

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ أَبِي حُصَيْنٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مَعْقِلٍ، قَالَ: "قَنَتَ فِي الْفَجْرِ رَجُلَانِ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ النَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: عَلِيٌّ، وَأَبُو مُوسَى
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, from Abu Husayn, from Abdullah ibn Ma’qil, who said: “Two men from the Companions of the Prophet ﷺ performed Qunut in the Fajr prayer: Ali and Abu Musa.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانُ ← أَبِي حُصَيْنٍ ← عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مَعْقِلٍ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Sufyan → Abu Husayn → Abdullah ibn Ma’qil

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ الرَّازِي، عَنِ الرَّبِيعِ، عَنْ أَنَسٍ، أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ قَنَتَ فِي الْفَجْرِ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, saying: Abu Ja’far AR-Razi narrated to us, from Ar-Rabi’, from Anas: “That the Prophet ﷺ performed Qunut in the Fajr prayer.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ الرَّازِي ← الرَّبِيعِ ← أَنَسٍ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Abu Ja’far AR-Razi → Ar-Rabi’ → Anas

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ عَوْفٍ، عَنْ أَبِي رَجَاءٍ الْعُطَارِدِيِّ، قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ ابْنَ عَبَّاسٍ يَمُدُّ بِضَبْعَيْهِ فِي قُنُوتِ صَلَاةِ الْغَدَاةِ، إِذَا كَانَ بِالْبَصْرَةِ
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, from Awf, from Abu Raja’ al-Utaridi, who said: “I saw Ibn Abbas extending his arms [stretching them out] during the Qunut of the Morning prayer (Fajr) when he was in Basra.”
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← عَوْفٍ ← أَبِي رَجَاءٍ الْعُطَارِدِيِّ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Awf → Abu Raja’ al-Utaridi

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو الْأَشْهَبِ جَعْفَرُ بْنُ حَيَّانَ، وَقُرَّةُ بْنُ خَالِدٍ، سَمِعَاهُ مِنْ أَبِي رَجَاءٍ الْعُطَارِدِيِّ، قَالَ: صَلَّى بِنَا ابْنُ عَبَّاسٍ الْفَجْرَ، بِالْبَصْرَةِ فَقَنَتَ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, saying: Abu al-Ashhab Ja’far ibn Hayyan and Qurrah ibn Khalid narrated to us, both hearing it from Abu Raja’ al-Utaridi, who said: “Ibn Abbas led us in the Fajr prayer in Basra and performed Qunut.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← أَبُو الْأَشْهَبِ جَعْفَرُ بْنُ حَيَّانَ وَقُرَّةُ بْنُ خَالِدٍ ← أَبِي رَجَاءٍ الْعُطَارِدِيِّ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Abu al-Ashhab Ja’far ibn Hayyan & Qurrah ibn Khalid → Abu Raja’ al-Utaridi

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا مِسْعَرٌ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ مَيْسَرَةَ، عَنْ زَيْدِ بْنِ وَهْبٍ، قَالَ: رُبَّمَا قَنَتَ عُمَرُ فِي صَلَاةِ الْفَجْرِ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, saying: Mis’ar narrated to us, from Abdul Malik ibn Maysarah, from Zayd ibn Wahb, who said: “Umar would sometimes perform Qunut in the Fajr prayer.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← مِسْعَرٌ ← عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ مَيْسَرَةَ ← زَيْدِ بْنِ وَهْبٍ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Mis’ar → Abdul Malik ibn Maysarah → Zayd ibn Wahb

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا شَرِيكٌ، عَنْ زُبَيْدٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى، قَالَ: الْقُنُوتُ سُنَّةٌ مَاضِيَةٌ
english_text: Sharik narrated to us, from Zubayd, from Ibn Abi Layla, who said: “Qunut is an established Sunnah.”
narrators_ar: شَرِيكٌ ← زُبَيْدٍ ← ابْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى
narrators_en: Sharik → Zubayd → Ibn Abi Layla

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ زُبَيْدِ بْنِ الْحَارِثِ الْيَامِيِّ، قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ ابْنَ أَبِي لَيْلَى، عَنْ الْقُنُوتِ فِي الْفَجْرِ؟ فَقَالَ: سُنَّةٌ مَاضِيَةٌ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, from Sufyan, from Zubayd ibn al-Harith al-Yami, who said: I asked Ibn Abi Layla about Qunut in Fajr? He said: “It is an established Sunnah.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانَ ← زُبَيْدِ بْنِ الْحَارِثِ الْيَامِيِّ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Sufyan → Zubayd ibn al-Harith al-Yami

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ، عَنِ ابْنِ سِيرِينَ، أَنَّهُ قَالَ: الْقُنُوتُ فِي الْفَجْرِ هُنَيْهَةٌ، أَوْ سَاعَةٌ، أَوْ كَلِمَةٌ تُشْبِهُهَا
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, saying: Yazid ibn Harun narrated to us, from Ibn Sirin, that he said: “Qunut in Fajr is a brief moment, or a short time, or a word similar to that.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ ← ابْنِ سِيرِينَ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Yazid ibn Harun → Ibn Sirin

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو مَهْدِيٍّ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ مُحَارِبِ بْنِ عُبَيْدِ بْنِ الْبَرَاءِ، عَنِ الْبَرَاءِ، أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقْنُتُ فِي الْفَجْرِ
english_text: Abu Mahdi narrated to us, from Sufyan, from Muharib ibn Ubayd ibn al-Bara’, from al-Bara’, “That he used to perform Qunut in Fajr.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو مَهْدِيٍّ ← سُفْيَانَ ← مُحَارِبِ بْنِ عُبَيْدِ بْنِ الْبَرَاءِ ← الْبَرَاءِ
narrators_en: Abu Mahdi → Sufyan → Muharib ibn Ubayd ibn al-Bara’ → Al-Bara’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: سَمِعْتُ وَكِيعًا، يَقُولُ: سَمِعْتُ سُفْيَانَ، يَقُولُ: مَنْ قَنَتَ فَحَسَنٌ، وَمَنْ لَمْ يَقْنُتْ فَحَسَنٌ، وَمَنْ قَنَتَ فَإِنَّمَا الْقُنُوتُ عَلَى الْإِمَامِ، وَلَيْسَ عَلَى مَنْ وَرَاءَهُ قُنُوتٌ
english_text: Abu Bakr said: I heard Waki’ say: I heard Sufyan say: “Whoever performs Qunut, it is good; and whoever does not perform Qunut, it is good. And whoever performs Qunut, indeed the Qunut is upon the Imam, and there is no Qunut upon those behind him.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعًا ← سُفْيَانَ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Waki’ → Sufyan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا يَحْيَى بْنُ سَعِيدٍ، عَنِ الْعَوَّامِ بْنِ حَمْزَةَ، قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عُثْمَانَ عَنْ الْقُنُوتِ، فَقَالَ: بَعْدَ الرُّكُوعِ، فَقُلْتُ: عَمَّنْ؟ فَقَالَ: عَنْ أَبِي بَكْرٍ، وَعُثْمَانَ
english_text: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Yahya ibn Sa’id narrated to us, from al-Awwam ibn Hamzah, who said: I asked Abu Uthman about Qunut. He said: “After the bowing (Ruku’).” I said: “From whom?” He said: “From Abu Bakr and Uthman.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← يَحْيَى بْنُ سَعِيدٍ ← الْعَوَّامِ بْنِ حَمْزَةَ ← أَبَا عُثْمَانَ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Yahya ibn Sa’id → Al-Awwam ibn Hamzah → Abu Uthman

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مَرْوَانُ بْنُ مُعَاوِيَةَ، عَنْ عَوْفٍ، عَنْ أَبِي رَجَاءٍ، قَالَ: صَلَّيْتُ مَعَ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، فِي مَسْجِدِ الْبَصْرَةِ، صَلَاةَ الْغَدَاةِ، فَقَنَتَ بِنَا قَبْلَ الرُّكُوعِ
english_text: Marwan ibn Mu’awiyah narrated to us, from Awf, from Abu Raja’, who said: “I prayed the Morning prayer (Fajr) with Ibn Abbas in the Mosque of Basra, and he performed Qunut with us before the bowing (Ruku’).”
narrators_ar: مَرْوَانُ بْنُ مُعَاوِيَةَ ← عَوْفٍ ← أَبِي رَجَاءٍ
narrators_en: Marwan ibn Mu’awiyah → Awf → Abu Raja’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مَرْوَانُ بْنُ مُعَاوِيَةَ، عَنْ عَوْفٍ، قَالَ: ذَكَرْتُ ذَلِكَ لِأَبِي الْمِنْهَالِ، فَحَدَّثَنِي عَنْ أَبِي الْعَالِيَةِ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، بِمِثْلِهِ
english_text: Marwan ibn Mu’awiyah narrated to us, from Awf, who said: I mentioned that to Abu al-Minhal, so he narrated to me from Abu al-Aliyah, from Ibn Abbas, similar to it.
narrators_ar: مَرْوَانُ بْنُ مُعَاوِيَةَ ← عَوْفٍ ← أَبِي الْمِنْهَالِ ← أَبِي الْعَالِيَةِ ← ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ
narrators_en: Marwan ibn Mu’awiyah → Awf → Abu al-Minhal → Abu al-Aliyah → Ibn Abbas

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ سَعِيدٍ، عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ يَحْيَى بْنِ حِبَّانَ، قَالَ: قَنَتَ النَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ أَرْبَعِينَ صَبَاحًا فِي صَلَاةِ الصُّبْحِ بَعْدَ الرُّكُوعِ
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, from Yahya ibn Sa’id, from Muhammad ibn Yahya ibn Hibban, who said: “The Prophet ﷺ performed Qunut for forty mornings in the Subh (Fajr) prayer after the bowing (Ruku’).”
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← يَحْيَى بْنِ سَعِيدٍ ← مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ يَحْيَى بْنِ حِبَّانَ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Yahya ibn Sa’id → Muhammad ibn Yahya ibn Hibban

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ فُضَيْلٍ، عَنْ حَجَّاجٍ، عَنْ عَيَّاشٍ الْعَامِرِيِّ، عَنِ ابْنِ مُغَفَّلٍ، أَنَّ عُمَرَ، وَعَلِيًّا، وَأَبَا مُوسَى، قَنَتُوا فِي الْفَجْرِ قَبْلَ الرُّكُوعِ
english_text: Muhammad ibn Fudayl narrated to us, from Hajjaj, from Ayyash al-Amiri, from Ibn Mughaffal: “That Umar, Ali, and Abu Musa performed Qunut in Fajr before the bowing (Ruku’).”
narrators_ar: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ فُضَيْلٍ ← حَجَّاجٍ ← عَيَّاشٍ الْعَامِرِيِّ ← ابْنِ مُغَفَّلٍ
narrators_en: Muhammad ibn Fudayl → Hajjaj → Ayyash al-Amiri → Ibn Mughaffal

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ فُضَيْلٍ، عَنْ مُطَرِّفٍ، عَنْ أَبِي الْجَهْمِ، عَنِ الْبَرَاءِ، أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقْنُتُ قَبْلَ الرَّكْعَةِ
english_text: Ibn Fudayl narrated to us, from Mutarrif, from Abu al-Jahm, from al-Bara’: “That he used to perform Qunut before the bowing (Rak’ah/Ruku’).”
narrators_ar: ابْنُ فُضَيْلٍ ← مُطَرِّفٍ ← أَبِي الْجَهْمِ ← الْبَرَاءِ
narrators_en: Ibn Fudayl → Mutarrif → Abu al-Jahm → Al-Bara’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا يَزِيدُ بْنُ أَبِي زِيَادٍ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا زَيْدُ بْنُ وَهْبٍ، أَنَّ عُمَرَ بْنَ الْخَطَّابِ قَنَتَ فِي صَلَاةِ الصُّبْحِ قَبْلَ الرُّكُوعِ
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Yazid ibn Abi Ziyad informed us, saying: Zayd ibn Wahb narrated to us: “That Umar ibn al-Khattab performed Qunut in the Subh prayer before the bowing (Ruku’).”
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← يَزِيدُ بْنُ أَبِي زِيَادٍ ← زَيْدُ بْنُ وَهْبٍ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Yazid ibn Abi Ziyad → Zayd ibn Wahb

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا عَلِيُّ بْنُ زَيْدٍ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا أَبُو عُثْمَانَ النَّهْدِيُّ، قَالَ: صَلَّيْتُ خَلْفَ عُمَرَ بْنِ الْخَطَّابِ، صَلَاةَ الصُّبْحِ فَقَنَتَ قَبْلَ الرُّكُوعِ
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Ali ibn Zayd informed us, saying: Abu Uthman an-Nahdi informed us, saying: “I prayed the Subh prayer behind Umar ibn al-Khattab, and he performed Qunut before the bowing (Ruku’).”
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← عَلِيُّ بْنُ زَيْدٍ ← أَبُو عُثْمَانَ النَّهْدِيُّ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Ali ibn Zayd → Abu Uthman an-Nahdi

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا عَطَاءُ بْنُ السَّائِبِ، عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ السُّلَمِيِّ، أَنَّ عَلِيًّا كَانَ يَقْنُتُ فِي صَلَاةِ الصُّبْحِ قَبْلَ الرُّكُوعِ
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Ata’ ibn as-Sa’ib informed us, from Abu Abdul Rahman as-Sulami: “That Ali used to perform Qunut in the Subh prayer before the bowing (Ruku’).”
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← عَطَاءُ بْنُ السَّائِبِ ← أَبِي عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ السُّلَمِيِّ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Ata’ ibn as-Sa’ib → Abu Abdul Rahman as-Sulami

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا ابْنُ أَبِي لَيْلَى، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ بْنِ عُمَيْرٍ، قَالَ: صَلَّيْتُ خَلْفَ عُمَرَ الْغَدَاةَ، قَالَ: فَقَنَتَ فِيهَا قَبْلَ الرُّكُوعِ
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Ibn Abi Layla informed us, from Ata’, from Ubayd ibn Umayr, who said: “I prayed the Morning prayer (Ghadah) behind Umar.” He said: “And he performed Qunut in it before the bowing (Ruku’).”
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← ابْنُ أَبِي لَيْلَى ← عَطَاءٍ ← عُبَيْدِ بْنِ عُمَيْرٍ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Ibn Abi Layla → Ata’ → Ubayd ibn Umayr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ أَبِي لَيْلَى، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ بْنِ عُمَيْرٍ، عَنْ عُمَرَ، بِمِثْلِهِ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, saying: Ibn Abi Layla narrated to us, from Ata’, from Ubayd ibn Umayr, from Umar, similar to it.
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← ابْنُ أَبِي لَيْلَى ← عَطَاءٍ ← عُبَيْدِ بْنِ عُمَيْرٍ ← عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Ibn Abi Layla → Ata’ → Ubayd ibn Umayr → Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ نُسَيْرِ بْنِ ذُعْلُوقٍ، قَالَ: صَلَّيْتُ خَلْفَ رَبِيعِ بْنِ خَيْثَمٍ، فَقَنَتَ قَبْلَ الرَّكْعَةِ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, from Nusayr ibn Dhu’luq, who said: “I prayed behind Rabi’ ibn Khaytham, and he performed Qunut before the bowing (Rak’ah).”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانُ ← نُسَيْرِ بْنِ ذُعْلُوقٍ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Sufyan → Nusayr ibn Dhu’luq

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، عَنِ النُّعْمَانِ بْنِ قَيْسٍ، قَالَ: صَلَّيْتُ خَلْفَ عَبِيدَةُ الْفَجْرَ فَقَنَتَ قَبْلَ الرَّكْعَةِ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, from an-Nu’man ibn Qays, who said: “I prayed Fajr behind Abidah, and he performed Qunut before the bowing (Rak’ah).”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانُ ← النُّعْمَانِ بْنِ قَيْسٍ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Sufyan → An-Nu’man ibn Qays

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا حُسَيْنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ، عَنْ زَائِدَةَ، عَنْ أَبِي فَرْوَةَ، قَالَ: ابْنُ أَبِي لَيْلَى، يَقْنُتُ فِي الْفَجْرِ قَبْلَ الرَّكْعَةِ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, saying: Husayn ibn Ali narrated to us, from Za’idah, from Abu Farwah, who said: “Ibn Abi Layla performs Qunut in Fajr before the bowing (Rak’ah).”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← حُسَيْنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ ← زَائِدَةَ ← أَبِي فَرْوَةَ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Husayn ibn Ali → Za’idah → Abu Farwah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِسْحَاقَ، عَنْ وُهَيْبٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ طَاوُسٍ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، قَالَ: كَانَ يَدْعُو بِدُعَاءٍ كَثِيرٍ فِي صَلَاةِ الصُّبْحِ قَبْلَ الرُّكُوعِ
english_text: Ahmad ibn Ishaq narrated to us, from Wuhayb, from Ibn Tawus, from his father, who said: “He used to supplicate with much supplication in the Subh prayer before the bowing (Ruku’).”
narrators_ar: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِسْحَاقَ ← وُهَيْبٍ ← ابْنِ طَاوُسٍ ← أَبِيهِ
narrators_en: Ahmad ibn Ishaq → Wuhayb → Ibn Tawus → His Father

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا ابْنُ أَبِي لَيْلَى، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ بْنِ عُمَيْرٍ، قَالَ: صَلَّيْتُ خَلْفَ عُمَرَ بْنِ الْخَطَّابِ الْغَدَاةَ، فَقَالَ فِي قُنُوتِهِ: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّا نَسْتَعِينُكَ وَنَسْتَغْفِرُكَ، وَنُثْنِي عَلَيْكَ الْخَيْرَ، وَلَا نَكْفُرُكَ، وَنَخْلَعُ، وَنَتْرُكُ مَنْ يَفْجُرُكَ، اللَّهُمَّ إِيَّاكَ نَعْبُدُ، وَلَكَ نُصَلِّي، وَنَسْجُدُ وَإِلَيْكَ نَسْعَى وَنَحْفِدُ، وَنَرْجُو رَحْمَتَكَ، وَنَخْشَى عَذَابَكَ، إِنَّ عَذَابَكَ بِالْكُفَّارِ مُلْحِقٌ
english_text: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Ibn Abi Layla informed us, from Ata’, from Ubayd ibn Umayr, who said: I prayed the Morning prayer (Ghadah) behind Umar ibn al-Khattab, and he said in his Qunut: “O Allah, we seek Your help and we seek Your forgiveness, and we praise You with good, and we do not disbelieve in You, and we cast off and abandon those who disobey You. O Allah, You alone we worship, and to You we pray and prostrate, and to You we strive and hasten. We hope for Your mercy and we fear Your punishment. Indeed, Your punishment will overtake the disbelievers.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هُشَيْمٌ ← ابْنُ أَبِي لَيْلَى ← عَطَاءٍ ← عُبَيْدِ بْنِ عُمَيْرٍ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hushaym → Ibn Abi Layla → Ata’ → Ubayd ibn Umayr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا حُصَيْنٌ، عَنْ زِرٍّ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبْزَى، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، أَنَّهُ صَلَّى خَلْفَ عُمَرَ فَصَنَعَ مِثْلَ ذَلِكَ
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Husayn informed us, from Zirr, from Sa’id ibn Abdul Rahman ibn Abza, from his father, that he prayed behind Umar and he did the same.
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← حُصَيْنٌ ← زِرٍّ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبْزَى ← أَبِيهِ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Husayn → Zirr → Sa’id ibn Abdul Rahman ibn Abza → His Father

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ حَبِيبِ بْنِ أَبِي ثَابِتٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ سُوَيْدٍ الْكَاهِلِيِّ، أَنَّ عَلِيًّا قَنَتَ فِي الْفَجْرِ بِهَاتَيْنِ السُّورَتَيْنِ: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّا نَسْتَعِينُكَ وَنَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَنُثْنِي عَلَيْكَ الْخَيْرَ، وَلَا نَكْفُرُ، وَنَخْلَعُ وَنَتْرُكُ مَنْ يَفْجُرُكَ، اللَّهُمَّ إِيَّاكَ نَعْبُدُ وَلَكَ نُصَلِّي وَنَسْجُدُ، وَإِلَيْكَ نَسْعَى وَنَحْفِدُ نَرْجُو رَحْمَتَكَ، وَنَخْشَى عَذَابَكَ، إِنَّ عَذَابَكَ الْجِدَّ بِالْكُفَّارِ مُلْحِقٌ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, from Habib ibn Abi Thabit, from Abdul Malik ibn Suwayd al-Kahili, that Ali performed Qunut in Fajr with these two Surahs: “O Allah, we seek Your help and we seek Your forgiveness, and we praise You with good, and we do not disbelieve, and we cast off and abandon those who disobey You. O Allah, You alone we worship, and to You we pray and prostrate, and to You we strive and hasten. We hope for Your mercy and we fear Your punishment. Indeed, Your severe punishment will overtake the disbelievers.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانُ ← حَبِيبِ بْنِ أَبِي ثَابِتٍ ← عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ سُوَيْدٍ الْكَاهِلِيِّ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Sufyan → Habib ibn Abi Thabit → Abdul Malik ibn Suwayd al-Kahili

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا جَعْفَرُ بْنُ بُرْقَانَ، عَنْ مَيْمُونِ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ، فِي قِرَاءَةِ أُبَيِّ بْنِ كَعْبٍ: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّا نَسْتَعِينُكَ وَنَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَنُثْنِي عَلَيْكَ، وَلَا نَكْفُرُكَ، وَنَخْلَعُ، وَنَتْرُكُ مَنْ يَفْجُرُكَ، اللَّهُمَّ إِيَّاكَ نَعْبُدُ، وَلَكَ نُصَلِّي وَنَسْجُدُ، وَإِلَيْكَ نَسْعَى وَنَرْجُو رَحْمَتَكَ، وَنَخْشَى عَذَابَكَ، إِنَّ عَذَابَكَ بِالْكُفَّارِ مُلْحِقٌ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, saying: Ja’far ibn Burqan informed us, from Maymun ibn Mihran, concerning the recitation of Ubayy ibn Ka’b: “O Allah, we seek Your help and we seek Your forgiveness, and we praise You, and we do not disbelieve in You, and we cast off and abandon those who disobey You. O Allah, You alone we worship, and to You we pray and prostrate, and to You we strive, and we hope for Your mercy and we fear Your punishment. Indeed, Your punishment will overtake the disbelievers.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← جَعْفَرُ بْنُ بُرْقَانَ ← مَيْمُونِ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Ja’far ibn Burqan → Maymun ibn Mihran

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حَفْصُ بْنُ غِيَاثٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ بْنِ نُمَيْرٍ، قَالَ: سَمِعْتُ عُمَرَ، يَقْنُتُ فِي الْفَجْرِ يَقُولُ: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ، اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّا نَسْتَعِينُكَ وَنُؤْمِنُ بِكَ، وَنَتَوَكَّلُ عَلَيْكَ وَنُثْنِي عَلَيْكَ الْخَيْرَ كُلَّهُ، وَلَا نَكْفُرُ ثُمَّ قَرَأَ: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَنِ الرَّحِيمِ اللَّهُمَّ إِيَّاكَ نَعْبُدُ، وَلَكَ نُصَلِّي وَنَسْجُدُ، وَإِلَيْكَ نَسْعَى وَنَحْفِدُ، نَرْجُو رَحْمَتَكَ، وَنَخْشَى عَذَابَكَ، إِنَّ عَذَابَكَ الْجِدَّ بِالْكُفَّارِ مُلْحِقٌ، اللَّهُمَّ عَذِّبْ كَفَرَةَ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ الَّذِينَ يَصُدُّونَ عَنْ سَبِيلِكَ
english_text: Hafs ibn Ghiyath narrated to us, from Ibn Jurayj, from Ata’, from Ubayd ibn Numayr, who said: I heard Umar performing Qunut in Fajr saying: “In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. O Allah, we seek Your help and we believe in You, and we rely upon You, and we praise You with all good, and we do not disbelieve.” Then he recited: “In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. O Allah, You alone we worship, and to You we pray and prostrate, and to You we strive and hasten. We hope for Your mercy and we fear Your punishment. Indeed, Your severe punishment will overtake the disbelievers. O Allah, punish the disbelievers of the People of the Book who obstruct Your path.”
narrators_ar: حَفْصُ بْنُ غِيَاثٍ ← ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ ← عَطَاءٍ ← عُبَيْدِ بْنِ نُمَيْرٍ
narrators_en: Hafs ibn Ghiyath → Ibn Jurayj → Ata’ → Ubayd ibn Numayr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا حُصَيْنٌ، قَالَ: صَلَّيْتُ الْغَدَاةَ ذَاتَ يَوْمٍ، وَصَلَّى خَلْفِي عُثْمَانُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ، قَالَ: فَقَنَتُّ فِي صَلَاةِ الصُّبْحِ، قَالَ: فَلَمَّا قَضَيْتُ صَلَاتِي، قَالَ لِي: مَا قُلْتَ فِي قُنُوتِكَ؟ قَالَ: فَقُلْتُ: ذَكَرْتُ هَؤُلَاءِ الْكَلِمَاتِ: اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّا نَسْتَعِينُكَ وَنَسْتَغْفِرُكَ وَنُثْنِي عَلَيْكَ الْخَيْرَ كُلَّهُ، وَلَا نَكْفُرُكَ، وَنَخْلَعُ وَنَتْرُكُ مَنْ يَفْجُرُكَ، اللَّهُمَّ إِيَّاكَ نَعْبُدُ وَلَكَ نُصَلِّي وَنَسْجُدُ، وَإِلَيْكَ نَسْعَى وَنَحْفِدُ نَرْجُو رَحْمَتَكَ، وَنَخْشَى عَذَابَكَ، إِنَّ عَذَابَكَ الْجِدَّ بِالْكُفَّارِ مُلْحِقٌ، فَقَالَ عُثْمَانُ: كَذَا كَانَ يَصْنَعُ عُمَرُ بْنُ الْخَطَّابِ، وَعُثْمَانُ بْنُ عَفَّانَ
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Husayn informed us, saying: I prayed the Morning prayer (Ghadah) one day, and Uthman ibn Ziyad prayed behind me. He said: So I performed Qunut in the Subh prayer. He said: When I finished my prayer, he said to me: “What did you say in your Qunut?” He said: So I said: I recited these words: “O Allah, we seek Your help and we seek Your forgiveness, and we praise You with all good, and we do not disbelieve in You, and we cast off and abandon those who disobey You. O Allah, You alone we worship, and to You we pray and prostrate, and to You we strive and hasten. We hope for Your mercy and we fear Your punishment. Indeed, Your severe punishment will overtake the disbelievers.” Uthman then said: “This is how Umar ibn al-Khattab and Uthman ibn Affan used to do.”
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← حُصَيْنٌ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Husayn

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعُ بْنُ الْجَرَّاحِ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ مُخَارِقٍ، عَنْ طَارِقِ بْنِ شِهَابٍ، أَنَّهُ صَلَّى خَلْفَ عُمَرَ بْنِ الْخَطَّابِ الْفَجْرَ، فَلَمَّا فَرَغَ مِنَ الْقِرَاءَةِ كَبَّرَ، ثُمَّ قَنَتَ، ثُمَّ كَبَّرَ، ثُمَّ رَكَعَ
english_text: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Waki’ ibn al-Jarrah narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, from Mukhariq, from Tariq ibn Shihab: “That he prayed Fajr behind Umar ibn al-Khattab. When he finished the recitation, he said Takbir, then performed Qunut, then said Takbir, then bowed (Ruku’).”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← وَكِيعُ بْنُ الْجَرَّاحِ ← سُفْيَانُ ← مُخَارِقٍ ← طَارِقِ بْنِ شِهَابٍ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Waki’ ibn al-Jarrah → Sufyan → Mukhariq → Tariq ibn Shihab

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْأَعْلَى، عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ السُّلَمِيِّ، أَنَّ عَلِيًّا، كَبَّرَ حِينَ قَنَتَ فِي الْفَجْرِ، وَكَبَّرَ حِينَ رَكَعَ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, from Abdul A’la, from Abu Abdul Rahman as-Sulami: “That Ali said Takbir when he performed Qunut in Fajr, and said Takbir when he bowed.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانُ ← عَبْدِ الْأَعْلَى ← أَبِي عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ السُّلَمِيِّ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Sufyan → Abdul A’la → Abu Abdul Rahman as-Sulami

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ فُضَيْلٍ، عَنْ مُطَرِّفٍ، عَنْ أَبِي الْجَهْمِ، قَالَ: كَانَ الْبَرَاءُ يُكَبِّرُ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَقْنُتَ
english_text: Ibn Fudayl narrated to us, from Mutarrif, from Abu al-Jahm, who said: “Al-Bara’ used to say Takbir before he performed Qunut.”
narrators_ar: ابْنُ فُضَيْلٍ ← مُطَرِّفٍ ← أَبِي الْجَهْمِ
narrators_en: Ibn Fudayl → Mutarrif → Abu al-Jahm

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ مُطَرِّفٍ، عَنْ أَبِي الْجَهْمِ، عَنِ الْبَرَاءِ، أَنَّهُ قَنَتَ فِي الْفَجْرِ فَكَبَّرَ حِينَ فَرَغَ مِنَ الْقِرَاءَةِ، وَكَبَّرَ حِينَ رَكَعَ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, from Mutarrif, from Abu al-Jahm, from al-Bara’: “That he performed Qunut in Fajr, so he said Takbir when he finished the recitation, and he said Takbir when he bowed.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانُ ← مُطَرِّفٍ ← أَبِي الْجَهْمِ ← الْبَرَاءِ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Sufyan → Mutarrif → Abu al-Jahm → Al-Bara’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حُمَيْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ، عَنْ حَسَنٍ، عَنْ أَبِي سِنَانٍ، عَنْ مَاهَانَ قَالَ: كَانَ يُكَبِّرُ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَقْنُتَ فِي صَلَاةِ الْفَجْرِ حِينَ يُرِيدُ أَنْ يَرْكَعَ
english_text: Humayd ibn Abdul Rahman narrated to us, from Hasan, from Abu Sinan, from Mahan, who said: “He used to say Takbir before performing Qunut in the Fajr prayer when he wanted to bow.”
narrators_ar: حُمَيْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ ← حَسَنٍ ← أَبِي سِنَانٍ ← مَاهَانَ
narrators_en: Humayd ibn Abdul Rahman → Hasan → Abu Sinan → Mahan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حُمَيْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ، عَنْ حَسَنٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْأَعْلَى، عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ، أَنَّهُ كَانَ يُكَبِّرُ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَقْنُتَ فِي صَلَاةِ الْفَجْرِ، وَحِينَ يُرِيدُ أَنْ يَرْكَعَ
english_text: Humayd ibn Abdul Rahman narrated to us, from Hasan, from Abdul A’la, from Abu Abdul Rahman: “That he used to say Takbir before performing Qunut in the Fajr prayer, and when he wanted to bow.”
narrators_ar: حُمَيْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ ← حَسَنٍ ← عَبْدِ الْأَعْلَى ← أَبِي عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ
narrators_en: Humayd ibn Abdul Rahman → Hasan → Abdul A’la → Abu Abdul Rahman

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زُهَيْرٍ، قَالَ: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي إِسْحَاقَ: تُكَبِّرُ أَنْتَ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَقْنُتَ فِي صَلَاةِ الْفَجْرِ؟ قَالَ: نَعَمْ
english_text: Humayd ibn Zuhayr narrated to us, saying: I said to Abu Ishaq: “Do you say Takbir before you perform Qunut in the Fajr prayer?” He said: “Yes.”
narrators_ar: حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زُهَيْرٍ ← أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ
narrators_en: Humayd ibn Zuhayr → Abu Ishaq

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا نَضْرُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ، عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى، عَنْ أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ، عَنِ الْحَارِثِ، عَنْ عَلِيٍّ، أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَفْتَتِحُ الْقُنُوتَ بِالتَّكْبِيرِ
english_text: Nadr ibn Isma’il narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Layla, from Abu Ishaq, from al-Harith, from Ali: “That he used to open the Qunut with Takbir.”
narrators_ar: نَضْرُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ ← ابْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى ← أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ ← الْحَارِثِ ← عَلِيٍّ
narrators_en: Nadr ibn Isma’il → Ibn Abi Layla → Abu Ishaq → Al-Harith → Ali

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا يَحْيَى بْنُ سَعِيدٍ، عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مَيْمُونٍ، عَنْ أَبِي عُثْمَانَ، قَالَ: كَانَ عُمَرُ يَقْنُتُ بِنَا بَعْدَ الرُّكُوعِ، وَيَرْفَعُ يَدَيْهِ حَتَّى يَبْدُوَ ضَبْعَاهُ، وَيُسْمَعَ صَوْتُهُ مِنْ وَرَاءِ الْمَسْجِدِ
english_text: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Yahya ibn Sa’id narrated to us, from Ja’far ibn Maymun, from Abu Uthman, who said: “Umar used to perform Qunut with us after the bowing (Ruku’), and he would raise his hands until his armpits appeared, and his voice could be heard from the back of the mosque.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← يَحْيَى بْنُ سَعِيدٍ ← جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مَيْمُونٍ ← أَبِي عُثْمَانَ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Yahya ibn Sa’id → Ja’far ibn Maymun → Abu Uthman

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ جَعْفَرٍ، صَاحِبِ الْأَنْمَاطِ، عَنْ أَبِي عُثْمَانَ، أَنَّ عُمَرَ، رَفَعَ يَدَيْهِ فِي قُنُوتِ الْفَجْرِ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, from Sufyan, from Ja’far (the owner of rugs), from Abu Uthman: “That Umar raised his hands in the Qunut of Fajr.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانَ ← جَعْفَرٍ صَاحِبِ الْأَنْمَاطِ ← أَبِي عُثْمَانَ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Sufyan → Ja’far (The owner of rugs) → Abu Uthman

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ عَوْفٍ، عَنْ خَلَّاسِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو الْهَجَرِيِّ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، أَنَّهُ صَلَّى، فَقَنَتَ بِهِمْ فِي الْفَجْرِ بِالْبَصْرَةِ، فَرَفَعَ يَدَيْهِ حَتَّى مَدَّ ضَبْعَيْهِ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, from Awf, from Khallas ibn Amr al-Hajari, from Ibn Abbas: “That he prayed and performed Qunut with them in Fajr in Basra, so he raised his hands until he stretched out his upper arms.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانُ ← عَوْفٍ ← خَلَّاسِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو الْهَجَرِيِّ ← ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Sufyan → Awf → Khallas ibn Amr al-Hajari → Ibn Abbas

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ عَوْفٍ، عَنْ أَبِي رَجَاءٍ، قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ ابْنَ عَبَّاسٍ يَمُدُّ بِضَبْعَيْهِ فِي قُنُوتِ صَلَاةِ الْغَدَاةِ
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, from Awf, from Abu Raja’, who said: “I saw Ibn Abbas extending his arms [stretching them out] in the Qunut of the Morning prayer.”
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← عَوْفٍ ← أَبِي رَجَاءٍ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Awf → Abu Raja’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حُسَيْنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ، عَنْ زَائِدَةَ، عَنْ أَبِي فَرْوَةَ، قَالَ: كَانَ ابْنُ أَبِي لَيْلَى يَدْعُو بِإِصْبَعٍ وَاحِدَةٍ يَقُولُ فِي قُنُوتِ الْفَجْرِ
english_text: Husayn ibn Ali narrated to us, from Za’idah, from Abu Farwah, who said: “Ibn Abi Layla used to supplicate with one finger, meaning in the Qunut of Fajr.”
narrators_ar: حُسَيْنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ ← زَائِدَةَ ← أَبِي فَرْوَةَ
narrators_en: Husayn ibn Ali → Za’idah → Abu Farwah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ عُيَيْنَةَ، عَنِ الزُّهْرِيِّ، عَنْ سَعِيدٍ، عَنْ أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ، قَالَ: لَمَّا رَفَعَ النَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ رَأْسَهُ مِنْ صَلَاةِ الصُّبْحِ، قَالَ: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْجِ الْوَلِيدَ بْنَ الْوَلِيدِ، وَسَلَمَةَ بْنَ هِشَامٍ، وَعَيَّاشَ بْنَ أَبِي رَبِيعَةَ، وَالْمُسْتَضْعَفِينَ بِمَكَّةَ، اللَّهُمَّ اشْدُدْ وَطْأَتَكَ عَلَى مُضَرَ، وَاجْعَلْهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سِنِينَ كَسِنِي يُوسُفَ
english_text: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Ibn Uyaynah narrated to us, from az-Zuhri, from Sa’id, from Abu Hurayrah, who said: When the Prophet ﷺ raised his head from the Subh prayer, he said: “O Allah, save al-Walid ibn al-Walid, and Salamah ibn Hisham, and Ayyash ibn Abi Rabi’ah, and the weak and oppressed in Makkah. O Allah, tighten Your grip on Mudar, and make it upon them years [of famine] like the years of Joseph.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← ابْنُ عُيَيْنَةَ ← الزُّهْرِيِّ ← سَعِيدٍ ← أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Ibn Uyaynah → Az-Zuhri → Sa’id → Abu Hurayrah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا يَعْقُوبُ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، عَنْ يَزِيدَ بْنِ أَبِي زِيَادٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي يُحَنَّسَ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ زَيْدٍ، قَالَ: قَنَتَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، فَقَالَ: اللَّهُمَّ الْعَنْ رِعْلًا، وَذَكْوَانَ، وَعَضَلًا، وَعُصَيَّةَ عَصَتِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ، وَالْعَنْ أَبَا الْأَعْوَرِ السُّلَمِيَّ
english_text: Ya’qub ibn Ibrahim narrated to us, from Yazid ibn Abi Ziyad, from Ibn Abi Yuhannas, from Sa’id ibn Zayd, who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ performed Qunut and said: “O Allah, curse Ri’l, Dhakwan, and Adal, and Usayyah who disobeyed Allah and His Messenger, and curse Abu al-A’war as-Sulami.”
narrators_ar: يَعْقُوبُ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ ← يَزِيدَ بْنِ أَبِي زِيَادٍ ← ابْنِ أَبِي يُحَنَّسَ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ زَيْدٍ
narrators_en: Ya’qub ibn Ibrahim → Yazid ibn Abi Ziyad → Ibn Abi Yuhannas → Sa’id ibn Zayd

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْأَعْلَى، أَنَّ أَبَا عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ السُّلَمِيَّ، قَنَتَ فِي الْفَجْرِ يَدْعُو عَلَى فَطَّةَ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, from Abdul A’la: “That Abu Abdul Rahman as-Sulami performed Qunut in Fajr supplicating against Fattah.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانُ ← عَبْدِ الْأَعْلَى
narrators_en: Waki’ → Sufyan → Abdul A’la

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ قَيْسٍ، عَمَّنْ سَمِعَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، يَقُولُ: لَا يُسَمَّى الرِّجَالُ فِي الصَّلَاةِ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, from Sufyan, from Amr ibn Qays, from one who heard Ibrahim say: “Men are not to be named in the prayer.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانَ ← عَمْرِو بْنِ قَيْسٍ ← سَمِعَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Sufyan → Amr ibn Qays → Heard Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا حُصَيْنٌ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ مَعْقِلٍ، قَالَ: صَلَّيْتُ مَعَ عَلِيٍّ صَلَاةَ الْغَدَاةِ، قَالَ: فَقَنَتَ، فَقَالَ فِي قُنُوتِهِ: اللَّهُمَّ عَلَيْكَ بِمُعَاوِيَةَ وَأَشْيَاعِهِ، وَعَمْرِو بْنِ الْعَاصِ وَأَشْيَاعِهِ، وَأَبِي السُّلَمِيِّ وَأَشْيَاعِهِ، وَعَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ قَيْسٍ وَأَشْيَاعِهِ
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Husayn informed us, saying: Abdul Rahman ibn Ma’qil narrated to us, saying: I prayed the Morning prayer (Ghadah) with Ali. He said: He performed Qunut and said in his Qunut: “O Allah, deal with Mu’awiyah and his partisans, and Amr ibn al-Aas and his partisans, and Abu as-Sulami and his partisans, and Abdullah ibn Qays and his partisans.”
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← حُصَيْنٌ ← عَبْدُ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ مَعْقِلٍ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Husayn → Abdul Rahman ibn Ma’qil

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ سَعِيدٍ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى بْنِ حِبَّانَ، قَالَ: مَكَثَ النَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ أَرْبَعِينَ صَبَاحًا، يَقْنُتُ فِي صَلَاةِ الصُّبْحِ بَعْدَ الرُّكُوعِ، وَكَانَ يَقُولُ فِي قُنُوتِهِ: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْجِ الْوَلِيدَ بْنَ الْوَلِيدِ، وَعَيَّاشَ بْنَ أَبِي رَبِيعَةَ، وَالْعَاصَ بْنَ هِشَامٍ، وَالْمُسْتَضْعَفِينَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ بِمَكَّةَ الَّذِينَ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ حِيلَةً، وَلَا يَهْتَدُونَ سَبِيلًا
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, from Yahya ibn Sa’id, who said: Muhammad ibn Yahya ibn Hibban narrated to us, saying: The Prophet ﷺ remained for forty mornings performing Qunut in the Subh prayer after the bowing (Ruku’), and he used to say in his Qunut: “O Allah, save al-Walid ibn al-Walid, and Ayyash ibn Abi Rabi’ah, and al-Aas ibn Hisham, and the weak and oppressed believers in Makkah who cannot find a device (for escape) nor are they guided to a path.”
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← يَحْيَى بْنِ سَعِيدٍ ← مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى بْنِ حِبَّانَ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Yahya ibn Sa’id → Muhammad ibn Yahya ibn Hibban

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْحَاقَ، عَنْ عِمْرَانَ بْنِ أَبِي أَنَسٍ، عَنْ حَنْظَلَةَ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ الْأَسْلَمِيِّ، عَنْ خُفَافِ بْنِ إِيمَاءِ بْنِ رَحَضَةَ الْغِفَارِيِّ، قَالَ: صَلَّى بِنَا رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ الْفَجْرَ فَلَمَّا رَفَعَ رَأْسَهُ مِنَ الرَّكْعَةِ الْآخِرَةِ، قَالَ: لَعَنَ اللَّهُ لِحْيَانًا، وَرِعْلًا، وَذَكْوانًا، وَعُصَيَّةَ عَصَتِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ، أَسْلَمُ سَالَمَهَا اللَّهُ، غِفَارٌ غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَهَا، ثُمَّ خَرَّ سَاجِدًا، فَلَمَّا قَضَى الصَّلَاةَ، أَقْبَلَ عَلَى النَّاسِ بِوَجْهِهِ، فَقَالَ: أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ إِنِّي أَنَا لَسْتُ قُلْتُ هَذَا، وَلَكِنَّ اللَّهَ قَالَهُ
english_text: Yazid ibn Harun narrated to us, saying: Muhammad ibn Ishaq informed us, from Imran ibn Abi Anas, from Hanzalah ibn Ali al-Aslami, from Khufaf ibn Ima’ ibn Rahadah al-Ghifari, who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ led us in the Fajr prayer. When he raised his head from the last Rak’ah, he said: “May Allah curse Lihyan, Ri’l, Dhakwan, and Usayyah who disobeyed Allah and His Messenger. Aslam, may Allah grant it peace (salamaha Allah). Ghifar, may Allah forgive it (ghafara Allah laha).” Then he fell down in prostration. When he finished the prayer, he turned his face to the people and said: “O people, indeed I did not say this (of my own accord), but Allah said it.”
narrators_ar: يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ ← مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْحَاقَ ← عِمْرَانَ بْنِ أَبِي أَنَسٍ ← حَنْظَلَةَ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ الْأَسْلَمِيِّ ← خُفَافِ بْنِ إِيمَاءِ بْنِ رَحَضَةَ الْغِفَارِيِّ
narrators_en: Yazid ibn Harun → Muhammad ibn Ishaq → Imran ibn Abi Anas → Hanzalah ibn Ali al-Aslami → Khufaf ibn Ima’ ibn Rahadah al-Ghifari

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ يُونُسَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، قَالَ: إِذَا نَسِيَ الْقُنُوتَ فِي الْفَجْرِ، فَعَلَيْهِ سَجْدَتَا السَّهْوِ
english_text: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Hushaym narrated to us, from Yunus, from al-Hasan, who said: “If one forgets the Qunut in Fajr, he must perform the two prostrations of forgetfulness (Sujud as-Sahw).”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هُشَيْمٌ ← يُونُسَ ← الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hushaym → Yunus → Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا شَرِيكٌ، عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى، قَالَ: سُئِلَ عَنْ رَجُلٍ سَهَا فَقَنَتَ، فَقَالَ: هَذَا سَهَا فَأَصَابَ
english_text: Sharik narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Layla, who said: He was asked about a man who was forgetful and (so he) performed Qunut. He said: “This one was forgetful but he did the right thing.”
narrators_ar: شَرِيكٌ ← ابْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى
narrators_en: Sharik → Ibn Abi Layla

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا الْوَلِيدُ بْنُ عُقْبَةَ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، عَنِ ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، قَالَ: مَنْ رَأَى الْقُنُوتَ فَلَمْ يَقْنُتْ، فَعَلَيْهِ سَجْدَتَا السَّهْوِ
english_text: Al-Walid ibn Uqbah narrated to us, saying: Sufyan narrated to us, from Ibn Jurayj, from Ata’, who said: “Whoever holds the view of (performing) Qunut but does not perform Qunut, he must perform the two prostrations of forgetfulness.”
narrators_ar: الْوَلِيدُ بْنُ عُقْبَةَ ← سُفْيَانُ ← ابْنِ جُرَيْجٍ ← عَطَاءٍ
narrators_en: Al-Walid ibn Uqbah → Sufyan → Ibn Jurayj → Ata’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ، وَوَكِيعٌ، وَغُنْدَرٌ، عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ مُرَّةَ، عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى، عَنِ الْبَرَاءِ بْنِ عَازِبٍ، أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، قَنَتَ فِي الصُّبْحِ، وَالْمَغْرِبِ، قَالَ: فَقَالَ إِبْرَاهِيمُ: أَهُوَ كَأَصْحَابِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ، إِنَّمَا هُوَ صَاحِبُ امْرِئٍ، وَلَمْ يَذْكُرْ وَكِيعٌ، قَوْلَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
english_text: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Abdullah ibn Idris, Waki’, and Ghundar narrated to us, from Shu’bah, from Amr ibn Murrah, from Ibn Abi Layla, from al-Bara’ ibn Azib: “That the Messenger of Allah ﷺ performed Qunut in the Subh and Maghrib prayers.” He said: Ibrahim then said: “Is he like the companions of Abdullah? He is only a companion of a man.” And Waki’ did not mention the statement of Ibrahim.
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ وَوَكِيعٌ وَغُنْدَرٌ ← شُعْبَةَ ← عَمْرِو بْنِ مُرَّةَ ← ابْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى ← الْبَرَاءِ بْنِ عَازِبٍ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Abdullah ibn Idris & Waki’ & Ghundar → Shu’bah → Amr ibn Murrah → Ibn Abi Layla → Al-Bara’ ibn Azib

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا شَرِيكٌ، عَنْ حُصَيْنٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ مَعْقِلٍ، قَالَ: قَنَتَ عَلِيٌّ فِي الْمَغْرِبِ
english_text: Sharik narrated to us, from Husayn, from Abdul Rahman ibn Ma’qil, who said: “Ali performed Qunut in Maghrib.”
narrators_ar: شَرِيكٌ ← حُصَيْنٍ ← عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ مَعْقِلٍ
narrators_en: Sharik → Husayn → Abdul Rahman ibn Ma’qil

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنْ خَالِدٍ، عَنْ أَبِي قِلَابَةَ، عَنْ أَنَسٍ، قَالَ: صَلَاتَانِ كَانَ يَقْنُتُ فِيهِمَا الْمَغْرِبُ، وَالْفَجْرُ
english_text: Ibn Ulayyah narrated to us, from Khalid, from Abu Qilabah, from Anas, who said: “Two prayers in which he used to perform Qunut were Maghrib and Fajr.”
narrators_ar: ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← خَالِدٍ ← أَبِي قِلَابَةَ ← أَنَسٍ
narrators_en: Ibn Ulayyah → Khalid → Abu Qilabah → Anas

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ، عَنِ الْأَعْمَشِ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ مُغَفَّلٍ، قَالَ: قَنَتَ عَلِيٌّ فِي الْمَغْرِبِ
english_text: Abu Mu’awiyah narrated to us, from al-A’mash, from Abdullah ibn Khalid, from Ibn Mughaffal, who said: “Ali performed Qunut in Maghrib.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ ← الْأَعْمَشِ ← عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ ← ابْنِ مُغَفَّلٍ
narrators_en: Abu Mu’awiyah → Al-A’mash → Abdullah ibn Khalid → Ibn Mughaffal

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا شَرِيكٌ، عَنْ ثَابِتٍ الثُّمَالِيِّ، قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ، عَنِ الْقُنُوتِ، فَقَالَ: كُلُّ صَلَاةٍ يُجْهَرُ فِيهَا، فَفِيهَا الْقُنُوتُ
english_text: Sharik narrated to us, from Thabit ath-Thumali, who said: I asked Abu Ja’far about Qunut. He said: “Every prayer in which recitation is made aloud, there is Qunut in it.”
narrators_ar: شَرِيكٌ ← ثَابِتٍ الثُّمَالِيِّ ← أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ
narrators_en: Sharik → Thabit ath-Thumali → Abu Ja’far

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا حَفْصُ بْنُ غِيَاثٍ، عَنِ الْأَعْمَشِ، عَنِ الْمِنْهَالِ، عَنْ أَبِي عُبَيْدَةَ، قَالَ: رَأَى عَبْدُ اللَّهِ رَجُلًا يُصَلِّي صَافًّا بَيْنَ قَدَمَيْهِ، فَقَالَ: لَوْ رَاوَحَ هَذَا بَيْنَ قَدَمَيْهِ، كَانَ أَفْضَلَ
english_text: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Hafs ibn Ghiyath narrated to us, from al-A’mash, from al-Minhal, from Abu Ubaydah, who said: Abdullah saw a man praying with his feet aligned [rigidly together], so he said: “If this one had alternated [rested/shifted weight] between his feet, it would have been better.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← حَفْصُ بْنُ غِيَاثٍ ← الْأَعْمَشِ ← الْمِنْهَالِ ← أَبِي عُبَيْدَةَ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hafs ibn Ghiyath → Al-A’mash → Al-Minhal → Abu Ubaydah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ مَيْسَرَةَ الْهُذَلِيِّ، عَنِ الْمِنْهَالِ، عَنْ أَبِي عُبَيْدَةَ، قَالَ: خَرَجَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ مِنْ دَارِهِ إِلَى الْمَسْجِدِ، وَإِذَا رَجُلٌ يُصَلِّي صَافًّا بَيْنَ قَدَمَيْهِ، فَقَالَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ: أَمَّا هَذَا فَقَدْ أَخْطَأَ السُّنَّةَ، وَلَوْ رَاوَحَ بَيْنَ قَدَمَيْهِ كَانَ أَحَبَّ إِلَيَّ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, from Sufyan, from Maysarah al-Hudhali, from al-Minhal, from Abu Ubaydah, who said: Abdullah went out from his house to the mosque, and there was a man praying with his feet aligned [rigidly]. Abdullah said: “As for this one, he has missed the Sunnah. If he had alternated [shifted weight] between his feet, it would have been more beloved to me.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانَ ← مَيْسَرَةَ الْهُذَلِيِّ ← الْمِنْهَالِ ← أَبِي عُبَيْدَةَ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Sufyan → Maysarah al-Hudhali → Al-Minhal → Abu Ubaydah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ عُيَيْنَةَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ، قَالَ: كُنْتُ مَعَ أَبِي فِي الْمَسْجِدِ، فَرَأَى رَجُلًا صَافًّا بَيْنَ قَدَمَيْهِ، فَقَالَ: أَلْزِقْ إِحْدَاهُمَا بِالْأُخْرَى، لَقَدْ رَأَيْتُ فِي هَذَا الْمَسْجِدِ ثَمَانِيَةَ عَشَرَ مِنْ أَصْحَابِ النَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، مَا رَأَيْتُ أَحَدًا مِنْهُمْ فَعَلَ هَذَا قَطُّ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, from Uyaynah ibn Abdul Rahman, who said: I was with my father in the mosque, and he saw a man aligning his feet [rigidly together]. He said [sarcastically/critically]: “Stick one of them to the other [completely then]! I have seen in this mosque eighteen of the Companions of the Prophet ﷺ, and I never saw anyone of them doing this ever.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← عُيَيْنَةَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ ← أَبِي
narrators_en: Waki’ → Uyaynah ibn Abdul Rahman → His Father

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا شَرِيكٌ، عَنْ أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ، قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ عَمْرَو بْنَ مَيْمُونٍ يُرَاوِحُ بَيْنَ قَدَمَيْهِ فِي الصَّلَاةِ
english_text: Sharik narrated to us, from Abu Ishaq, who said: “I saw Amr ibn Maymun alternating [shifting weight] between his feet in prayer.”
narrators_ar: شَرِيكٌ ← أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ
narrators_en: Sharik → Abu Ishaq

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ أَبِي خَالِدٍ، قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ عَمْرَو بْنَ مَيْمُونٍ، يُرَاوِحُ بَيْنَ قَدَمَيْهِ، يَضَعُ هَذِهِ عَلَى هَذِهِ وَهَذِهِ عَلَى هَذِهِ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, from Isma’il ibn Abi Khalid, who said: “I saw Amr ibn Maymun alternating between his feet, placing [weight] on this one and on this one.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ أَبِي خَالِدٍ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Isma’il ibn Abi Khalid

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عَدِيٍّ، عَنْ يُوسُفَ بْنِ عَبْدَةَ، قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ ابْنَ سِيرِينَ يُصَلِّي وَهُوَ هَكَذَا، يَعْنِي يُقَدِّمُ رِجْلًا، وَيُؤَخِّرُ أُخْرَى
english_text: Muhammad ibn Abi Adi narrated to us, from Yusuf ibn Abdah, who said: “I saw Ibn Sirin praying while he was like this,” meaning he would put one foot forward and the other back.
narrators_ar: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عَدِيٍّ ← يُوسُفَ بْنِ عَبْدَةَ
narrators_en: Muhammad ibn Abi Adi → Yusuf ibn Abdah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ، عَنْ هِشَامٍ، قَالَ: كَانَ ابْنُ سِيرِينَ يُرَاوِحُ بَيْنَ قَدَمَيْهِ فِي الصَّلَاةِ
english_text: Yazid ibn Harun narrated to us, from Hisham, who said: “Ibn Sirin used to alternate between his feet in prayer.”
narrators_ar: يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ ← هِشَامٍ
narrators_en: Yazid ibn Harun → Hisham

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مَعْنُ بْنُ عِيسَى، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ، قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ مَكْحُولًا يَتَّكِئُ عَلَى قَدَمَيْهِ عَلَى هَذِهِ مَرَّةً، وَعَلَى هَذِهِ مَرَّةً فِي الصَّلَاةِ
english_text: Ma’n ibn Isa narrated to us, from Abdullah ibn Rashid, who said: “I saw Makhul leaning on his feet, on this one once and on this one once in prayer.”
narrators_ar: مَعْنُ بْنُ عِيسَى ← عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ
narrators_en: Ma’n ibn Isa → Abdullah ibn Rashid

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مَعْنُ بْنُ عِيسَى، عَنْ خَالِدِ بْنِ أَبِي بَكْرٍ، قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ سَالِمًا لَا يَصُفُّ قَدَمَيْهِ فِي الصَّلَاةِ، وَيُحَرِّكُهَا وَهُوَ يُصَلِّي
english_text: Ma’n ibn Isa narrated to us, from Khalid ibn Abi Bakr, who said: “I saw Salim not aligning his feet [rigidly] in prayer, and he would move them while praying.”
narrators_ar: مَعْنُ بْنُ عِيسَى ← خَالِدِ بْنِ أَبِي بَكْرٍ
narrators_en: Ma’n ibn Isa → Khalid ibn Abi Bakr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدَةُ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ عُرْوَةَ، عَنْ رَجُلٍ، أَنَّ ابْنَ الزُّبَيْرِ، كَانَ يَصُفُّ بَيْنَ قَدَمَيْهِ فِي الصَّلَاةِ
english_text: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Abdah ibn Sulayman narrated to us, from Hisham ibn Urwah, from a man: “That Ibn az-Zubayr used to align his feet in prayer.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدَةُ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ ← هِشَامِ بْنِ عُرْوَةَ ← رَجُلٍ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Abdah ibn Sulayman → Hisham ibn Urwah → A Man

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ عُرْوَةَ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنِي مَنْ، رَأَى ابْنَ الزُّبَيْرِ، يُصَلِّي قَدْ صَفَّ بَيْنَ قَدَمَيْهِ، وَأَلْزَقَ إِحْدَاهُمَا بِالْأُخْرَى
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, from Hisham ibn Urwah, who said: I was informed by someone who saw Ibn az-Zubayr praying, having aligned his feet and stuck one of them to the other.
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← هِشَامِ بْنِ عُرْوَةَ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Hisham ibn Urwah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ حُصَيْنٍ، قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ ابْنَ مُغَفَّلٍ يُصَلِّي صَافًّا بَيْنَ قَدَمَيْهِ
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, from Husayn, who said: “I saw Ibn Mughaffal praying, aligning his feet.”
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← حُصَيْنٍ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Husayn

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُعَاذُ بْنُ مُعَاذٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَوْنٍ، قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ مُسْلِمَ بْنَ يَسَارٍ يُصَلِّي كَأَنَّهُ وِدٌّ لَا يَتَرَوَّحُ عَلَى رِجْلٍ مَرَّةً، وَعَلَى رِجْلٍ مَرَّةً
english_text: Mu’adh ibn Mu’adh narrated to us, from Ibn Awn, who said: “I saw Muslim ibn Yasar praying as if he were a stake [peg], not resting on one leg at a time and on the other at a time.”
narrators_ar: مُعَاذُ بْنُ مُعَاذٍ ← ابْنِ عَوْنٍ
narrators_en: Mu’adh ibn Mu’adh → Ibn Awn

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ مَهْدِيٍّ، عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ ابْنَ عُمَرَ يُصَلِّي صَافًّا بَيْنَ قَدَمَيْهِ فِي مَا نَعْلَمُ
english_text: Ibn Mahdi narrated to us, from Shu’bah, from Sa’d ibn Ibrahim, who said: “I saw Ibn Umar praying, aligning his feet, as far as we know.”
narrators_ar: ابْنُ مَهْدِيٍّ ← شُعْبَةَ ← سَعْدِ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Ibn Mahdi → Shu’bah → Sa’d ibn Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ مَهْدِيٍّ، عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ، عَنْ مَالِكِ بْنِ دِينَارٍ، قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ عِكْرِمَةَ يُصَلِّي صَافًّا بَيْنَ قَدَمَيْهِ
english_text: Ibn Mahdi narrated to us, from Isma’il ibn Muslim, from Malik ibn Dinar, who said: “I saw Ikrimah praying, aligning his feet.”
narrators_ar: ابْنُ مَهْدِيٍّ ← إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ ← مَالِكِ بْنِ دِينَارٍ
narrators_en: Ibn Mahdi → Isma’il ibn Muslim → Malik ibn Dinar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا زَيْدُ بْنُ حُبَابٍ، عَنْ قُرَيْشِ بْنِ حَيَّانَ، قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ الْحَسَنَ يُصَلِّي صَافًّا بَيْنَ قَدَمَيْهِ
english_text: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Zayd ibn Hubab narrated to us, from Quraysh ibn Hayyan, who said: “I saw al-Hasan praying, aligning his feet.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← زَيْدُ بْنُ حُبَابٍ ← قُرَيْشِ بْنِ حَيَّانَ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Zayd ibn Hubab → Quraysh ibn Hayyan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مَعْنُ بْنُ عِيسَى، عَنْ مُخْتَارِ بْنِ سَعْدٍ، قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ الْقَاسِمَ بْنَ مُحَمَّدٍ يَصُفُّ رِجْلَيْهِ فِي الصَّلَاةِ، وَلَا يُرَاوِحُ بَيْنَهُمَا
english_text: Ma’n ibn Isa narrated to us, from Mukhtar ibn Sa’d, who said: “I saw al-Qasim ibn Muhammad aligning his legs in prayer, and he did not alternate between them.”
narrators_ar: مَعْنُ بْنُ عِيسَى ← مُخْتَارِ بْنِ سَعْدٍ
narrators_en: Ma’n ibn Isa → Mukhtar ibn Sa’d

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ حُصَيْنٍ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ جُبَيْرٍ، قَالَ: "مَنْ دَخَلَ الْمَسْجِدَ وَقَدْ سُبِقَ بِالصَّلَاةِ، قَالَ: يَبْدَأُ بِالْمَكْتُوبَةِ
english_text: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Hushaym narrated to us, from Husayn, from Sa’id ibn Jubayr, who said: “Whoever enters the mosque and has missed the prayer (Jama’ah), he said: He begins with the obligatory prayer.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هُشَيْمٌ ← حُصَيْنٍ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ جُبَيْرٍ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hushaym → Husayn → Sa’id ibn Jubayr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبَّادُ بْنُ الْعَوَّامِ، عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي نَجِيحٍ، عَنْ رَجُلٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ، قَالَ: يَبْدَأُ بِالْمَكْتُوبَةِ
english_text: Abbad ibn al-Awwam narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Najih, from a man, from Ibn Umar, who said: “He begins with the obligatory prayer.”
narrators_ar: عَبَّادُ بْنُ الْعَوَّامِ ← ابْنِ أَبِي نَجِيحٍ ← رَجُلٍ ← ابْنِ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Abbad ibn al-Awwam → Ibn Abi Najih → A Man → Ibn Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، وَوَكِيعٌ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَوْنٍ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، قَالَ: ابْدَأْ بِالَّذِي جِئْتَ لَهُ
english_text: Hushaym and Waki’ narrated to us, from Ibn Awn, from ash-Sha’bi, who said: “Start with what you came for.”
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ وَوَكِيعٌ ← ابْنِ عَوْنٍ ← الشَّعْبِيِّ
narrators_en: Hushaym & Waki’ → Ibn Awn → Ash-Sha’bi

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حَفْصُ بْنُ غِيَاثٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَوْنٍ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، قَالَ: ابْدَأْ بِالْمَكْتُوبَةِ
english_text: Hafs ibn Ghiyath narrated to us, from Ibn Awn, from ash-Sha’bi, who said: “Start with the obligatory prayer.”
narrators_ar: حَفْصُ بْنُ غِيَاثٍ ← ابْنِ عَوْنٍ ← الشَّعْبِيِّ
narrators_en: Hafs ibn Ghiyath → Ibn Awn → Ash-Sha’bi

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنِ الزُّبَيْرِ بْنِ عَدِيٍّ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، قَالَ: ابْدَأْ بِالْمَكْتُوبَةِ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, from Sufyan, from az-Zubayr ibn Adi, from Ibrahim, who said: “Start with the obligatory prayer.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانَ ← الزُّبَيْرِ بْنِ عَدِيٍّ ← إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Sufyan → Az-Zubayr ibn Adi → Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ أَفْلَحَ، قَالَ: جِئْتُ أَنَا، وَالْقَاسِمُ الْمَسْجِدَ، وَقَدْ صَلَّوْا، فَصَلَّى لِنَفْسِهِ يَعْنِي بَدَأَ بِالْمَكْتُوبَةِ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, from Aflah, who said: “I and al-Qasim came to the mosque, and they had already prayed, so he prayed for himself,” meaning he started with the obligatory prayer.
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← أَفْلَحَ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Aflah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، عَنِ الْحَكَمِ، قَالَ: كَانُوا يَبْدَءُونَ بِالْمَكْتُوبَةِ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, from Shu’bah, from al-Hakam, who said: “They used to start with the obligatory prayer.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← شُعْبَةَ ← الْحَكَمِ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Shu’bah → Al-Hakam

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا غُنْدَرٌ، عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، قَالَ: قَالَ الْحَكَمُ: كَانُوا يَبْدَءُونَ بِالْفَرِيضَةِ، وَقَالَ ابْنُ إِسْحَاقَ: كَانُوا يَبْدَءُونَ بِالْفَرِيضَةِ
english_text: Ghundar narrated to us, from Shu’bah, who said: Al-Hakam said: “They used to start with the obligatory prayer (Faridah).” And Ibn Ishaq said: “They used to start with the obligatory prayer.”
narrators_ar: غُنْدَرٌ ← شُعْبَةَ ← الْحَكَمُ
narrators_en: Ghundar → Shu’bah → Al-Hakam

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ مِسْعَرٍ، عَنِ الْعَبَّاسِ بْنِ ذُرَيْحٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ، قَالَ: مَثَلُ الَّذِي يَدْخُلُ الْمَسْجِدَ وَقَدْ صَلَّى فِيهِ فَيَتَطَوَّعُ، مَثَلُ الَّذِي يَعْتَمِرُ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَحُجَّ
english_text: Waki’ narrated to us, from Mis’ar, from al-Abbas ibn Dhurayh, from Ibn Abbas, who said: “The likeness of the one who enters the mosque when they have already prayed in it, and he performs voluntary prayer, is like the one who performs Umrah before he performs Hajj.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← مِسْعَرٍ ← الْعَبَّاسِ بْنِ ذُرَيْحٍ ← ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Mis’ar → Al-Abbas ibn Dhurayh → Ibn Abbas

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى، عَنْ مَعْمَرٍ، عَنْ يَزِيدَ بْنِ أَبِي زِيَادٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى، قَالَ: ابْدَأْ بِالَّذِي جِئْتَ لَهُ
english_text: Abdul A’la narrated to us, from Ma’mar, from Yazid ibn Abi Ziyad, from Abdul Rahman ibn Abi Layla, who said: “Start with what you came for.”
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الْأَعْلَى ← مَعْمَرٍ ← يَزِيدَ بْنِ أَبِي زِيَادٍ ← عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى
narrators_en: Abdul A’la → Ma’mar → Yazid ibn Abi Ziyad → Abdul Rahman ibn Abi Layla

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ مُبَارَكٍ، عَنْ مِسْعَرٍ، عَنِ الْعَبَّاسِ بْنِ ذُرَيْحٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ فِي رَجُلٍ دَخَلَ مَسْجِدًا، وَقَدْ صَلَّى أَهْلُهُ أَيَتَطَوَّعُ؟ قَالَ: هُوَ كَرَجُلٍ يَتَطَوَّعُ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَحُجَّ
english_text: Ibn Mubarak narrated to us, from Mis’ar, from al-Abbas ibn Dhurayh, from Ibn Abbas regarding a man who entered a mosque and its people had already prayed, should he perform voluntary prayer? He said: “He is like a man who performs voluntary worship before he performs Hajj.”
narrators_ar: ابْنُ مُبَارَكٍ ← مِسْعَرٍ ← الْعَبَّاسِ بْنِ ذُرَيْحٍ ← ابْنِ عَبَّاسٍ
narrators_en: Ibn Mubarak → Mis’ar → Al-Abbas ibn Dhurayh → Ibn Abbas

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ حُصَيْنٍ، عَنْ ذِرٍّ، قَالَ: يَتَطَوَّعُ إِنْ شَاءَ
english_text: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Hushaym narrated to us, from Husayn, from Dhirr, who said: “He may perform voluntary prayer if he wishes.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هُشَيْمٌ ← حُصَيْنٍ ← ذِرٍّ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hushaym → Husayn → Dhirr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنِ الْعَوَّامِ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ أَبِي الْهُذَيْلِ، أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَتَطَوَّعُ إِذَا سُبِقَ بِالْمَكْتُوبَةِ
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, from al-Awwam, from Abdullah ibn Abi al-Hudhayl: “That he used to perform voluntary prayer if he missed the obligatory prayer.”
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← الْعَوَّامِ ← عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ أَبِي الْهُذَيْلِ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Al-Awwam → Abdullah ibn Abi al-Hudhayl

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حَفْصٌ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَوْنٍ، قَالَ: سُئِلَ الْحَسَنُ عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يَدْخُلُ الْمَسْجِدَ، وَقَدْ صَلَّى أَهْلُهُ، قَالَ: فَقَالَ: أَمَّا أَنَا فَكُنْتُ أُصَلِّي لِمَا كُنْتُ أُصَلِّي قَبْلَ ذَلِكَ
english_text: Hafs narrated to us, from Ibn Awn, who said: Al-Hasan was asked about a man who enters the mosque when its people have already prayed. He said: He said: “As for me, I would pray what I usually pray before it.”
narrators_ar: حَفْصٌ ← ابْنِ عَوْنٍ ← الْحَسَنُ
narrators_en: Hafs → Ibn Awn → Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا غُنْدَرٌ، عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، عَنْ حَمَّادٍ، قَالَ: لَا بَأْسَ بِهِ إِذَا كَانَ فِي وَقْتِ صَلَاةٍ
english_text: Ghundar narrated to us, from Shu’bah, from Hammad, who said: “There is no harm in it if it is within the prayer time.”
narrators_ar: غُنْدَرٌ ← شُعْبَةَ ← حَمَّادٍ
narrators_en: Ghundar → Shu’bah → Hammad

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَخْبَرَنَا وَكِيعٌ، قَالَ: نَا شُعْبَةُ، قَالَ: قَالَ حَمَّادٌ: يَتَطَوَّعُ إِنْ شَاءَ
english_text: Waki’ informed us, saying: Shu’bah narrated to us, saying: Hammad said: “He may perform voluntary prayer if he wishes.”
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← شُعْبَةُ ← حَمَّادٌ
narrators_en: Waki’ → Shu’bah → Hammad

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا يُونُسُ بْنُ عُبَيْدٍ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنِي أَبُو عُثْمَانَ الْيَشْكُرِيُّ، قَالَ: مَرَّ بِنَا أَنَسُ بْنُ مَالِكٍ، وَقَدْ صَلَّيْنَا صَلَاةَ الْغَدَاةِ، وَمَعَهُ رَهْطٌ، فَأَمَرَ رَجُلًا مِنْهُمْ فَأَذَّنَ، ثُمَّ صَلَّوْا رَكْعَتَيْنِ، قَبْلَ الْفَجْرِ، قَالَ: ثُمَّ أَمَرُوهُ، فَأَقَامَ، ثُمَّ تَقَدَّمَ فَصَلَّى بِهِمْ
english_text: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Yunus ibn Ubayd informed us, saying: Abu Uthman al-Yashkuri narrated to me, saying: “Anas ibn Malik passed by us, and we had already prayed the Morning prayer (Ghadah). He was with a group, so he ordered a man among them to call Adhan, then they prayed two Rak’ahs before Fajr (i.e. Sunnah). He said: Then they ordered him, and he called Iqbal (Iqamah), then he stepped forward and led them in prayer.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هُشَيْمٌ ← يُونُسُ بْنُ عُبَيْدٍ ← أَبُو عُثْمَانَ الْيَشْكُرِيُّ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hushaym → Yunus ibn Ubayd → Abu Uthman al-Yashkuri

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنِ الْجَعْدِ أَبِي عُثْمَانَ، عَنْ أَنَسٍ، بِمِثْلِهِ
english_text: Isma’il ibn Ulayyah narrated to us, from al-Ja’d Abu Uthman, from Anas, similar to it.
narrators_ar: إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← الْجَعْدِ أَبِي عُثْمَانَ ← أَنَسٍ
narrators_en: Isma’il ibn Ulayyah → Al-Ja’d Abu Uthman → Anas

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُعَاذُ بْنُ مُعَاذٍ، عَنْ أَبِي حُرَّةَ، قَالَ: دَخَلْتُ أَنَا وَعَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ حُمَيْدٍ مَسْجِدًا وَقَدْ صُلِّيَ فِيهِ، قَالَ: أَلَا تَجِيءُ حَتَّى نُصَلِّيَ فِي جَمَاعَةٍ؟ قُلْتُ: إِنَّ بَعْضَهُمْ قَدْ كَرِهَ ذَلِكَ، قَالَ: كَانَ أَبِي لَا يَرَى بِذَلِكَ بَأْسًا
english_text: Mu’adh ibn Mu’adh narrated to us, from Abu Hurrah, who said: I and Abdullah ibn Humayd entered a mosque in which prayer had already been performed. He said: “Will you not come so we can pray in congregation?” I said: “Some people have disliked that.” He said: “My father saw no harm in that.”
narrators_ar: مُعَاذُ بْنُ مُعَاذٍ ← أَبِي حُرَّةَ
narrators_en: Mu’adh ibn Mu’adh → Abu Hurrah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدَةُ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عَرُوبَةَ، عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ النَّاجِي، عَنْ أَبِي الْمُتَوَكِّلِ، عَنْ أَبِي سَعِيدٍ، قَالَ: جَاءَ رَجُلٌ وَقَدْ صَلَّى النَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، فَقَالَ: أَيُّكُمْ يَتَّجِرُ عَلَى هَذَا؟ قَالَ: فَقَامَ رَجُلٌ مِنَ الْقَوْمِ فَصَلَّى مَعَهُ
english_text: Abdah ibn Sulayman narrated to us, from Ibn Abi Arubah, from Sulayman an-Naji, from Abu al-Mutawakkil, from Abu Sa’id, who said: A man came after the Prophet ﷺ had already prayed. He said: “Who among you will trade (gain reward/charity) with this man?” He said: So a man from the people stood up and prayed with him.
narrators_ar: عَبْدَةُ بْنُ سُلَيْمَانَ ← ابْنِ أَبِي عَرُوبَةَ ← سُلَيْمَانَ النَّاجِي ← أَبِي الْمُتَوَكِّلِ ← أَبِي سَعِيدٍ
narrators_en: Abdah ibn Sulayman → Ibn Abi Arubah → Sulayman an-Naji → Abu al-Mutawakkil → Abu Sa’id

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، قَالَ: أَنْبَأَنَا سُلَيْمَانُ التَّيْمِيُّ، عَنْ أَبِي عُثْمَانَ، قَالَ: دَخَلَ رَجُلٌ الْمَسْجِدَ وَقَدْ صَلَّى النَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، فَقَالَ: أَلَا رَجُلٌ يَتَصَدَّقُ عَلَى هَذَا فَيَقُومُ فَيُصَلِّي مَعَهُ؟
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Sulayman at-Taymi informed us, from Abu Uthman, who said: A man entered the mosque after the Prophet ﷺ had prayed. He said: “Is there no man who will give charity to this one by standing up and praying with him?”
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← سُلَيْمَانُ التَّيْمِيُّ ← أَبِي عُثْمَانَ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Sulayman at-Taymi → Abu Uthman

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا شَرِيكٌ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ يَزِيدَ، قَالَ: دَخَلْتُ مَعَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، مَسْجِدَ مُحَارِبٍ وَقَدْ صَلَّوْا فَأَمَّنِي
english_text: Sharik narrated to us, from Abdullah ibn Yazid, who said: “I entered the mosque of Muharib with Ibrahim, and they had already prayed, so he led me in prayer.”
narrators_ar: شَرِيكٌ ← عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ يَزِيدَ
narrators_en: Sharik → Abdullah ibn Yazid

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ زِيَادٍ، مَوْلَى قُرَيْشٍ، قَالَ: دَخَلْتُ مَعَ الْحَسَنِ مَسْجِدَ الْبَصْرَةِ، فَوَجَدْنَاهُمْ قَدْ صَلَّوْا فَصَلَّى بِي
english_text: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Hushaym narrated to us, from Ziyad (Mawla of Quraysh), who said: “I entered the Mosque of Basra with al-Hasan, and we found they had already prayed, so he led me in prayer.”
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هُشَيْمٌ ← زِيَادٍ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hushaym → Ziyad

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حَفْصٌ، عَنْ أَشْعَثَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، أَنَّهُ كَانَ لَا يَرَى بَأْسًا أَنْ تُصَلَّى الْجَمَاعَةُ بَعْدَ الْجَمَاعَةِ فِي مَسْجِدِ الْكِلَاءِ بِالْبَصْرَةِ
english_text: Hafs narrated to us, from Ash’ath, from al-Hasan: “That he saw no harm in prayer being held congregation after congregation in the Mosque of al-Kila’ in Basra.”
narrators_ar: حَفْصٌ ← أَشْعَثَ ← الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Hafs → Ash’ath → Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا مَنْصُورٌ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، قَالَ: إِنَّمَا كَانُوا يَكْرَهُونَ أَنْ يَجْمَعُوا مَخَافَةَ السُّلْطَانِ
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Mansur informed us, from al-Hasan, who said: “They only used to dislike gathering [for a second congregation] out of fear of the ruler (Sultan).”
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← مَنْصُورٌ ← الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Mansur → Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ مُسَافِرٍ الْجَصَّاصِ، عَنْ فُضَيْلِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو، أَنَّ عَدِيَّ بْنَ ثَابِتٍ، وَأَصْحَابًا لَهُ رَجَعُوا مِنْ جِنَازَةٍ فَدَخَلُوا مَسْجِدًا، وَقَدْ صُلِّيَ فِيهِ فَجَمَعُوا فَكَرِهَ ذَلِكَ إِبْرَاهِيمُ
english_text: Waki‘ narrated to us from Musafir al-Jassas, from Fudayl ibn ‘Amr, that ‘Adi ibn Thabit and companions of his returned from a funeral and entered a mosque where the prayer had already been performed, so they prayed in congregation (Jama‘ah). Ibrahim [al-Nakha‘i] disliked that.
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← مُسَافِرٍ الْجَصَّاصِ ← فُضَيْلِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو ← عَدِيَّ بْنَ ثَابِتٍ
narrators_en: Waki‘ → Musafir al-Jassas → Fudayl ibn ‘Amr → ‘Adi ibn Thabit

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ عَبْدِ رَبِّهِ بْنِ أَبِي رَاشِدٍ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا يَحْيَى، قَالَ: جَاءَنَا أَنَسُ بْنُ مَالِكٍ، وَقَدْ صَلَّيْنَا الْغَدَاةَ، فَأَقَامَ الصَّلَاةَ، ثُمَّ صَلَّى بِهِمْ فَقَامَ وَسَطَهُمْ
english_text: Waki‘ narrated to us from ‘Abd Rabbih ibn Abi Rashid, who said: Yahya narrated to us, saying: Anas ibn Malik came to us after we had prayed the Morning Prayer (Al-Ghadah/Fajr). He established the prayer (gave Iqamah), then led them in prayer and stood in their middle.
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← عَبْدِ رَبِّهِ بْنِ أَبِي رَاشِدٍ ← يَحْيَى ← أَنَسُ بْنُ مَالِكٍ
narrators_en: Waki‘ → ‘Abd Rabbih ibn Abi Rashid → Yahya → Anas ibn Malik

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ، عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ، عَنْ عَطَاءٍ، أَنَّهُ صَلَّى هُوَ وَسَالِمُ بْنُ عَطِيَّةَ، فِي الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ فِي جَمَاعَةٍ، بَعْدَمَا صَلَّى أَهْلُهُ
english_text: Abu Mu‘awiyah narrated to us from ‘Amr ibn Muhammad, from ‘Ata’, that he and Salim ibn ‘Atiyyah prayed in the Sacred Mosque (Masjid al-Haram) in congregation after its people had already prayed.
narrators_ar: أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ ← عَمْرِو بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ ← عَطَاءٍ
narrators_en: Abu Mu‘awiyah → ‘Amr ibn Muhammad → ‘Ata’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنْ سَعِيدٍ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، أَنَّهُ قَالَ: يُصَلُّونَ جَمِيعًا فِي صَفٍّ وَاحِدٍ إِمَامُهُمْ وَسَطُهُمْ
english_text: Ibn ‘Ulayyah narrated to us from Sa‘id, from Qatadah, that he said: "They pray all together in one row, and their Imam is in their middle."
narrators_ar: ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← سَعِيدٍ ← قَتَادَةَ
narrators_en: Ibn ‘Ulayyah → Sa‘id → Qatadah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا إِسْحَاقُ الْأَزْرَقُ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ أَبِي سُلَيْمَانَ، عَنْ سَلَمَةَ بْنِ كُهَيْلٍ، أَنَّ ابْنَ مَسْعُودٍ دَخَلَ الْمَسْجِدَ وَقَدْ صَلَّوْا فَجَمَعَ بِعَلْقَمَةَ، وَمَسْرُوقٍ، وَالْأَسْوَدِ
english_text: Ishaq al-Azraq narrated to us from ‘Abd al-Malik ibn Abi Sulayman, from Salamah ibn Kuhayl, that Ibn Mas‘ud entered the mosque after they had prayed, so he prayed in congregation with ‘Alqamah, Masruq, and Al-Aswad.
narrators_ar: إِسْحَاقُ الْأَزْرَقُ ← عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ أَبِي سُلَيْمَانَ ← سَلَمَةَ بْنِ كُهَيْلٍ ← ابْنَ مَسْعُودٍ
narrators_en: Ishaq al-Azraq → ‘Abd al-Malik ibn Abi Sulayman → Salamah ibn Kuhayl → Ibn Mas‘ud

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مَنْ قَالَ: يُصَلُّونَ فُرَادَى، وَلَا يَجْمَعُونَ حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، عَنْ يُونُسَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقُولُ: يُصَلُّونَ فُرَادَى
english_text: [Chapter: Who said: They pray individually and do not gather] Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Hushaym narrated to us from Yunus, from Al-Hasan, that he used to say: "They pray individually."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هُشَيْمٌ ← يُونُسَ ← الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hushaym → Yunus → Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنْ أَيُّوبَ، عَنْ أَبِي قِلَابَةَ، قَالَ: يُصَلُّونَ فُرَادَى
english_text: Ibn ‘Ulayyah narrated to us from Ayyub, from Abu Qilabah, who said: "They pray individually."
narrators_ar: ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← أَيُّوبَ ← أَبِي قِلَابَةَ
narrators_en: Ibn ‘Ulayyah → Ayyub → Abu Qilabah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنْ يُونُسَ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، قَالَ: يُصَلُّونَ فُرَادَى
english_text: Ibn ‘Ulayyah narrated to us from Yunus, from Al-Hasan, who said: "They pray individually."
narrators_ar: ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← يُونُسَ ← الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Ibn ‘Ulayyah → Yunus → Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ أَبِي هِلَالٍ، عَنْ كَثِيرٍ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، قَالَ: كَانَ أَصْحَابُ مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، إِذَا دَخَلُوا الْمَسْجِدَ وَقَدْ صُلِّيَ فِيهِ صَلَّوْا فُرَادَى
english_text: Waki‘ narrated to us from Abu Hilal, from Kathir, from Al-Hasan, who said: "When the Companions of Muhammad ﷺ entered the mosque and the prayer had already been performed in it, they would pray individually."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← أَبِي هِلَالٍ ← كَثِيرٍ ← الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: Waki‘ → Abu Hilal → Kathir → Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ أَفْلَحَ، قَالَ: دَخَلْنَا مَعَ الْقَاسِمِ الْمَسْجِدَ وَقَدْ صُلِّيَ فِيهِ، قَالَ: فَصَلَّى الْقَاسِمُ وَحْدَهُ
english_text: Waki‘ narrated to us from Aflah, who said: We entered the mosque with Al-Qasim [ibn Muhammad] after the prayer had been performed in it. He said: "So Al-Qasim prayed alone."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← أَفْلَحَ ← الْقَاسِمِ
narrators_en: Waki‘ → Aflah → Al-Qasim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا الرَّجُلُ تَفُوتُهُ بَعْضُ الصَّلَاةِ مَعَ الْإِمَامِ حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا مَنْصُورٌ، عَنِ الْحَسَنِ، عَنْ عَلِيٍّ، أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقُولُ: "مَنْ أَدْرَكَ مَعَ الْإِمَامِ رَكْعَتَيْنِ، قَالَ: يَقْرَأُ فِيمَا أَدْرَكَ
english_text: [Chapter: The man who misses part of the prayer with the Imam] Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Mansur informed us, from Al-Hasan, from ‘Ali, that he used to say: "Whoever catches two Rak‘ahs with the Imam," he said, "he should recite in what he caught."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← هُشَيْمٌ ← مَنْصُورٌ ← الْحَسَنِ ← عَلِيٍّ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Hushaym → Mansur → Al-Hasan → ‘Ali

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: نَا إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ عَيَّاشٍ، عَنْ سَعِيدِ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ، أَنَّ عُمَرَ بْنَ الْخَطَّابِ، وَأَبَا الدَّرْدَاءِ، كَانَا يَقُولَانِ: مَا أَدْرَكْتَ مِنْ صَلَاةِ الْإِمَامِ فَاجْعَلْهُ أَوَّلَ صَلَاتِكَ
english_text: Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Isma‘il ibn ‘Ayyash narrated to us from Sa‘id ibn Abi ‘Abd al-Rahman, that ‘Umar ibn al-Khattab and Abu al-Darda’ used to say: "Whatever you catch of the Imam's prayer, make it the beginning of your prayer."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ عَيَّاشٍ ← سَعِيدِ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ ← عُمَرَ بْنَ الْخَطَّابِ + أَبَا الدَّرْدَاءِ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Isma‘il ibn ‘Ayyash → Sa‘id ibn Abi ‘Abd al-Rahman → ‘Umar ibn al-Khattab + Abu al-Darda’

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ عَيَّاشٍ، عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ مُهَاجِرٍ، قَالَ: سَمِعْتُ عُمَرَ بْنَ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ، يَقُولُ: اجْعَلْهُ أَوَّلَ صَلَاتِكَ
english_text: Isma‘il ibn ‘Ayyash narrated to us from ‘Amr ibn Muhajir, who said: I heard ‘Umar ibn ‘Abd al-‘Aziz say: "Make it the beginning of your prayer."
narrators_ar: إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ عَيَّاشٍ ← عَمْرِو بْنِ مُهَاجِرٍ ← عُمَرَ بْنَ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ
narrators_en: Isma‘il ibn ‘Ayyash → ‘Amr ibn Muhajir → ‘Umar ibn ‘Abd al-‘Aziz

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدَةُ، عَنْ سَعِيدٍ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ سَعِيدٍ، وَالْحَسَنِ، قَالَا: مَا أَدْرَكْتَ مَعَ الْإِمَامِ فَهُوَ أَوَّلُ صَلَاتِكَ
english_text: ‘Abdah narrated to us from Sa‘id, from Qatadah, from Sa‘id and Al-Hasan, that they said: "Whatever you catch with the Imam is the beginning of your prayer."
narrators_ar: عَبْدَةُ ← سَعِيدٍ ← قَتَادَةَ ← سَعِيدٍ + الْحَسَنِ
narrators_en: ‘Abdah → Sa‘id → Qatadah → Sa‘id + Al-Hasan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدَةُ، عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عَرُوبَةَ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ عَلِيٍّ، مِثْلَهُ
english_text: ‘Abdah narrated to us from Ibn Abi ‘Arubah, from Qatadah, from ‘Ali, the like of it.
narrators_ar: عَبْدَةُ ← ابْنِ أَبِي عَرُوبَةَ ← قَتَادَةَ ← عَلِيٍّ
narrators_en: ‘Abdah → Ibn Abi ‘Arubah → Qatadah → ‘Ali

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو خَالِدٍ الْأَحْمَرُ، عَنِ الْأَعْمَشِ، قَالَ: كَانَ سَعِيدُ بْنُ جُبَيْرٍ، يَقُولُ: يَقْرَأُ فِيمَا أَدْرَكَ، لِأَنَّهُ كَانَ يُسِرُّ الْقِرَاءَةَ خَلْفَ الْإِمَامِ
english_text: Abu Khalid al-Ahmar narrated to us from Al-A‘mash, who said: Sa‘id ibn Jubayr used to say: "He recites in what he catches, because he used to recite silently behind the Imam."
narrators_ar: أَبُو خَالِدٍ الْأَحْمَرُ ← الْأَعْمَشِ ← سَعِيدُ بْنُ جُبَيْرٍ
narrators_en: Abu Khalid al-Ahmar → Al-A‘mash → Sa‘id ibn Jubayr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو خَالِدٍ الْأَحْمَرُ، عَنْ أَشْعَثَ، عَنْ أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ، عَنِ الْحَارِثِ، عَنْ عَلِيٍّ، فِي الرَّجُلِ تَفُوتُهُ مَعَ الْإِمَامِ الرَّكْعَةُ، أَوِ الرَّكْعَتَانِ، قَالَ: يَقْرَأُ فِي سَكْتَةِ الْإِمَامِ وَقَالَ الْحَسَنُ: مِثْلَهُ
english_text: Abu Khalid al-Ahmar narrated to us from Ash‘ath, from Abu Ishaq, from Al-Harith, from ‘Ali, regarding a man who misses a Rak‘ah or two with the Imam, he said: "He recites during the Imam's silence." Al-Hasan said the same.
narrators_ar: أَبُو خَالِدٍ الْأَحْمَرُ ← أَشْعَثَ ← أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ ← الْحَارِثِ ← عَلِيٍّ
narrators_en: Abu Khalid al-Ahmar → Ash‘ath → Abu Ishaq → Al-Harith → ‘Ali

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مَنْ قَالَ: مَا أَدْرَكْتَ مَعَ الْإِمَامِ فَاجْعَلْهُ آخِرَ صَلَاتِكَ حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ، عَنْ حُصَيْنٍ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ، قَالَ: مَا أَدْرَكْتَ مَعَ الْإِمَامِ فَهُوَ آخِرُ صَلَاتِكَ
english_text: [Chapter: Who said: Whatever you catch with the Imam, make it the end of your prayer] Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: ‘Abdullah ibn Idris narrated to us from Husayn, from Ibrahim, from ‘Abdullah [ibn Mas‘ud], who said: "Whatever you catch with the Imam is the end of your prayer."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ ← حُصَيْنٍ ← إِبْرَاهِيمَ ← عَبْدِ اللَّهِ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → ‘Abdullah ibn Idris → Husayn → Ibrahim → ‘Abdullah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ سَلَمَةَ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنِ ابْنِ سِيرِينَ، عَنِ ابْنِ مَسْعُودٍ قَالَ: اجْعَلْ آخِرَ صَلَاتِكَ مَا أَدْرَكْتَ مِنْ صَلَاتِكَ
english_text: Waki‘ narrated to us from Hammad ibn Salamah, from Qatadah, from Ibn Sirin, from Ibn Mas‘ud, who said: "Make what you caught of your prayer the end of your prayer."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← حَمَّادِ بْنِ سَلَمَةَ ← قَتَادَةَ ← ابْنِ سِيرِينَ ← ابْنِ مَسْعُودٍ
narrators_en: Waki‘ → Hammad ibn Salamah → Qatadah → Ibn Sirin → Ibn Mas‘ud

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنْ أَيُّوبَ، عَنْ نَافِعٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ، أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَجْعَلُ مَا أَدْرَكَ مَعَ الْإِمَامِ آخِرَ صَلَاتِهِ
english_text: Ibn ‘Ulayyah narrated to us from Ayyub, from Nafi‘, from Ibn ‘Umar, that he used to make what he caught with the Imam the end of his prayer.
narrators_ar: ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← أَيُّوبَ ← نَافِعٍ ← ابْنِ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Ibn ‘Ulayyah → Ayyub → Nafi‘ → Ibn ‘Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حَفْصٌ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ، عَنْ نَافِعٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ أَنَّهُ كَانَ إِذَا أَدْرَكَ مَعَ الْإِمَامِ لَمْ يَقْرَأْ فَإِذَا قَامَ يَقْضِي قَرَأَ
english_text: Hafs narrated to us from ‘Ubaydullah, from Nafi‘, from Ibn ‘Umar, that if he caught [the prayer] with the Imam, he would not recite [to himself as if it were the start], but when he stood up to make up [what he missed], he would recite.
narrators_ar: حَفْصٌ ← عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ ← نَافِعٍ ← ابْنِ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Hafs → ‘Ubaydullah → Nafi‘ → Ibn ‘Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ، عَنْ نَافِعٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ، أَنَّهُ قَالَ: اقْرَأْ فِيمَا تَقْضِي
english_text: Abu Mu‘awiyah narrated to us from ‘Ubaydullah, from Nafi‘, from Ibn ‘Umar, that he said: "Recite in what you are making up."
narrators_ar: أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ ← عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ ← نَافِعٍ ← ابْنِ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Abu Mu‘awiyah → ‘Ubaydullah → Nafi‘ → Ibn ‘Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا هُشَيْمٌ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا حُصَيْنٌ، وَمُغِيرَةُ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، قَالَ: يَقْرَأُ فِيمَا يَقْضِي
english_text: Hushaym narrated to us, saying: Husayn and Mughirah informed us, from Ibrahim, who said: "He recites in what he makes up."
narrators_ar: هُشَيْمٌ ← حُصَيْنٌ + مُغِيرَةُ ← إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Hushaym → Husayn + Mughirah → Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنِ ابْنِ عَوْنٍ قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ مُجَاهِدًا عَنْ رَجُلٍ فَاتَتْهُ رَكْعَتَانِ مَعَ الْإِمَامِ فَقَرَأَ فِيهِمَا، قَالَ: اجْعَلْ آخِرَ صَلَاتِكَ أَوَّلَ صَلَاتِكَ
english_text: Waki‘ narrated to us from Ibn ‘Awn, who said: I asked Mujahid about a man who missed two Rak‘ahs with the Imam and recited in them [i.e., in the ones he caught, treating them as his first]. He said: "Make the end of your prayer [what you do with the Imam] the beginning of your prayer [i.e., treat what you caught as the start]."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← ابْنِ عَوْنٍ ← مُجَاهِدًا
narrators_en: Waki‘ → Ibn ‘Awn → Mujahid

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ الْوَهَّابِ، عَنْ أَيُّوبَ، عَنْ أَبِي قِلَابَةَ، فِي رَجُلٍ تَفُوتُهُ بَعْضُ الصَّلَاةِ، فَيَقُومُ يَقْضِي، قَالَ: يَجْعَلُ مَا بَقِيَ أَوَّلَ صَلَاتِهِ، وَإِنْ عَلِمْتَ مَا الَّذِي قَرَأَهُ الْإِمَامُ، فَاقْرَأْهُ
english_text: ‘Abd al-Wahhab narrated to us from Ayyub, from Abu Qilabah, regarding a man who misses part of the prayer and stands to make it up. He said: "He makes what remains [what he is making up] the beginning of his prayer. And if you know what the Imam recited, then recite it."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ الْوَهَّابِ ← أَيُّوبَ ← أَبِي قِلَابَةَ
narrators_en: ‘Abd al-Wahhab → Ayyub → Abu Qilabah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ نَافِعٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ، قَالَ: سَمِعْتُ عَمْرَو بْنَ دِينَارٍ يَقُولُ: اقْضِ مَا فَاتَكَ كَمَا فَاتَكَ
english_text: Waki‘ narrated to us from Nafi‘, from Ibn ‘Umar, who said: I heard ‘Amr ibn Dinar say: "Make up what you missed exactly as you missed it."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← نَافِعٍ ← ابْنِ عُمَرَ ← عَمْرَو بْنَ دِينَارٍ
narrators_en: Waki‘ → Nafi‘ → Ibn ‘Umar → ‘Amr ibn Dinar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا يَعْقُوبُ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، عَنْ أَشْعَثَ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، وَابْنِ سِيرِينَ أَنَّهُمَا قَالَا فِيمَنْ سَبَقَهُ الْإِمَامُ: إِذَا قَضَيْتَ بَعْدَهُ، فَاقْضِ قِرَاءَتَكَ
english_text: Ya‘qub ibn Ibrahim narrated to us from Ash‘ath, from Al-Sha‘bi and Ibn Sirin, that they said regarding one whom the Imam preceded: "If you make up [the prayer] after him, then make up your recitation."
narrators_ar: يَعْقُوبُ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ ← أَشْعَثَ ← الشَّعْبِيِّ + ابْنِ سِيرِينَ
narrators_en: Ya‘qub ibn Ibrahim → Ash‘ath → Al-Sha‘bi + Ibn Sirin

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ، عَنْ عَمْرٍو، قَالَ: فَاتَتْ عُبَيْدَ بْنَ عُمَيْرٍ رَكْعَةٌ مِنَ الْمَغْرِبِ، فَسَمِعْتُهُ يَقْرَأُ وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَى
english_text: Ibn ‘Ulayyah narrated to us from ‘Amr, who said: ‘Ubayd ibn ‘Umayr missed a Rak‘ah of Maghrib, so I heard him recite 'By the night when it covers' (Surah Al-Layl) [when making it up].
narrators_ar: ابْنُ عُلَيَّةَ ← عَمْرٍو ← عُبَيْدَ بْنَ عُمَيْرٍ
narrators_en: Ibn ‘Ulayyah → ‘Amr → ‘Ubayd ibn ‘Umayr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو خَالِدٍ، عَنِ الْأَعْمَشِ، قَالَ: كَانَ إِبْرَاهِيمُ يَقْرَأُ فِيمَا يَقْضِي
english_text: Abu Khalid narrated to us from Al-A‘mash, who said: Ibrahim used to recite in what he was making up.
narrators_ar: أَبُو خَالِدٍ ← الْأَعْمَشِ ← إِبْرَاهِيمُ
narrators_en: Abu Khalid → Al-A‘mash → Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا الرَّجُلُ يُصَلِّي فَيَضَعُ إِحْدَى رِجْلَيْهِ عَلَى الْأُخْرَى حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا جَرِيرٌ، عَنْ مُغِيرَةَ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، قَالَ: يُكْرَهُ أَنْ يَرْفَعَ الرَّجُلُ إِحْدَى رِجْلَيْهِ عَلَى الْأُخْرَى فِي الصَّلَاةِ، أَوْ يَسْتَنِدُ إِلَى جِدَارٍ، إِلَّا مِنْ عِلَّةٍ
english_text: [Chapter: The man who prays putting one of his legs on the other] Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Jarir narrated to us from Mughirah, from Ibrahim, who said: "It is disliked for a man to raise one of his legs onto the other during prayer, or to lean against a wall, unless it is due to an ailment."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← جَرِيرٌ ← مُغِيرَةَ ← إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Jarir → Mughirah → Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ هَانِئٍ، قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ عَمْرَو بْنَ مَيْمُونٍ قَائِمًا يُصَلِّي وَاضِعًا إِحْدَى رِجْلَيْهِ عَلَى الْأُخْرَى
english_text: Waki‘ narrated to us from Sufyan, from Yahya ibn Hani’, who said: "I saw ‘Amr ibn Maymun standing praying while placing one of his legs on the other."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ ← سُفْيَانَ ← يَحْيَى بْنِ هَانِئٍ ← عَمْرَو بْنَ مَيْمُونٍ
narrators_en: Waki‘ → Sufyan → Yahya ibn Hani’ → ‘Amr ibn Maymun

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا فِي الْإِمَامِ يُصَلِّي جَالِسًا حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ بْنُ عُيَيْنَةَ، عَنِ الزُّهْرِيِّ، قَالَ: سَمِعْتُ أَنَسًا، قَالَ: سَقَطَ النَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ عَنْ فَرَسٍ، فَجُحِشَ شِقُّهُ الْأَيْمَنُ، فَدَخَلْنَا عَلَيْهِ نَعُودُهُ، فَحَضَرَتِ الصَّلَاةُ، فَصَلَّى بِنَا قَاعِدًا، فَصَلَّيْنَا وَرَاءَهُ قُعُودًا، فَلَمَّا قَضَى الصَّلَاةَ قَالَ: "إِنَّمَا جُعِلَ الْإِمَامُ لِيُؤْتَمَّ بِهِ، فَإِذَا كَبَّرَ فَكَبِّرُوا، وَإِذَا رَكَعَ فَارْكَعُوا، وَإِذَا قَالَ: سَمِعَ اللَّهُ لِمَنْ حَمِدَهُ، فَقُولُوا: رَبَّنَا وَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ، وَإِذَا صَلَّى قَاعِدًا فَصَلُّوا قُعُودًا أَجْمَعُونَ
english_text: [Chapter: Regarding the Imam praying while sitting] Abu Bakr narrated to us, saying: Sufyan ibn ‘Uyaynah narrated to us from Al-Zuhri, who said: I heard Anas say: The Prophet ﷺ fell from a horse and his right side was scraped. We went in to visit him, and the time for prayer came, so he led us in prayer while sitting, and we prayed behind him sitting. When he finished the prayer, he said: "The Imam is appointed only to be followed. So when he says Takbir, say Takbir; when he bows, bow; when he says 'Allah hears whoever praises Him', say 'Our Lord, and to You is praise'; and if he prays sitting, then pray sitting all together."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ ← سُفْيَانُ بْنُ عُيَيْنَةَ ← الزُّهْرِيِّ ← أَنَسًا
narrators_en: Abu Bakr → Sufyan ibn ‘Uyaynah → Al-Zuhri → Anas

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدَةُ، عَنْ هِشَامٍ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنْ عَائِشَةَ، قَالَتِ: اشْتَكَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، فَدَخَلَ نَاسٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِهِ يَعُودُونَهُ، فَصَلَّى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ جَالِسًا، فَصَلُّوا بِصَلَاتِهِ قِيَامًا، وَأَشَارَ إِلَيْهِمْ أَنِ اجْلِسُوا فَجَلَسُوا، فَلَمَّا انْصَرَفَ قَالَ: إِنَّمَا جُعِلَ الْإِمَامُ لِيُؤْتَمَّ بِهِ، فَإِذَا رَكَعَ فَارْكَعُوا، وَإِذَا رَفَعَ فَارْفَعُوا، وَإِذَا صَلَّى جَالِسًا فَصَلُّوا جُلُوسًا
english_text: ‘Abdah narrated to us from Hisham, from his father, from ‘Aishah, who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ was in pain, so some people from his Companions came to visit him. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ prayed sitting, and they prayed following his prayer standing. He gestured to them to sit, so they sat. When he finished, he said: "The Imam is appointed only to be followed. So when he bows, bow; when he rises, rise; and if he prays sitting, then pray sitting."
narrators_ar: عَبْدَةُ ← هِشَامٍ ← أَبِيهِ ← عَائِشَةَ
narrators_en: ‘Abdah → Hisham → His Father → ‘Aishah
